characters: THE CAR IS HEADING DOWN A COUNTRY ROAD.
AT THE REAR OF THE HOUSE
FADE TO BLACK WITH THE DEPARTING HEADLIGHTS
BRIAN'S DESK IN ANOTHER PART OF LOFT APARTMENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining like hell. Flashes of lightning reveal momen glimpses of a decayed urban/industrial landscape. Far bel us, a mysterious glistening wet rock lies engulfed in the drowning earth. We descend toward the rock. Sporadic flas of lightning distort our perspective of the stone. It loo strangely beautiful, like a diamond stuck in the dark mud Closer... Closer... Suddenly, STRONG MALE HANDS cut across the frame and wren it free from its muddy grave. Even closer... And we disco that the underbelly of this beautiful rock is teeming wit every kind of slithering repulsive insect... FLASH!!*  Lightning obliterates the frame. (* FLASHES OF LIGHT from lightning, car headlights,  photographic strobe units and flashlights are used throug the following sequences as recurring transitional devices

dialogues.speaker: CITY STREET EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: We can barely see the darkened street in a run down part an inner city -- what we can see looks half demolished.  Flash!! Through chain link fencing, the blinding headlights of a  70'S CHEVY arc into frame. For an instant we see the flee image of a PRETTY TEENAGE GIRL. On her feet a pair of bri red high heeled shoes. The Chevy pulls up next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!! An oncoming car's headlights streak across the be up Chevy's windshield... revealing... THE DRIVER, 45ish, he leans across the passenger seat and opens the car door The pretty teenage girl slides into the car. Dressed only a skirt and T-Shirt, she's soaked to the skin. Make-up ru down her face and her hair sticks to her bare shoulders. seems nervous... scared even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she closes the car door the man notices that her hand been injured. It's bound with coarse white toweling and  stained with blood. In her other hand, she clings tightly a cheap yellow leather purse. He reaches forward and puts his hand on the gear-shift, the back of his hand brushing against her leg, she moves away. He slides the gear-shift into drive. Another car's headlights flare the windshield as he pulls out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly... a powerful photographic strobe light ignites! Revealing a decrepit warehouse interior. Silhouetted brie against the paint chipped walls are two figures: A man, B KESSLER, 25, short chopped hair dressed in black on black and a woman, CARRIE LAUGHLIN, 25, short black hair and ti black clothes. Carrie holds a 35mm still camera, an umbil cord runs to a strobe light. Brian holds a flashlight in hand, a tape recorder in the other. He begins speaking in the tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her father worked the night shift  here. Most nights he'd bring her  with him. (pause) She was eleven years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His flashlight scans the ominous environment. Carrie take flash photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerging from the blackness... The same strong male hands that unearthed the rock now pulls his rain soaked jacket  clear of his torso. A crude bandage wrapped around one of the fingers. The rock is slipped up under his jacket... u against his bare chest. The jacket is pulled down to conc the rock and the faceless figure drifts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beam of Brian's flashlight sweeps through the darknes revealing another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. This is the where he'd  take her whenever he had the urge to  molest her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlight finds the corner in question. Flash!! The  warehouse lights up again, revealing a huge machine room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! Nobody would have heard  her cries over the noise of the  machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A male hand wipes the steamy condensation clear of his ca front window. The windshield wipers swipe incessantly at constant sheet of rain beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! This defroster never works...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver fidgets blindly with the various levers and kn He finally manages to get the defroster and heater to wor The girl leans forward into the stream of warm air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mmm... feels good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes, lets it blow across her face. He wat her. His eyes linger on her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a problem with your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls her wet hair off her bruised face and gives him nervous smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) My problem's with men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws a curious look at her, then back to the highway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's flashlight moves around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where she murdered her first  victim. They found his body over in  the corner, shot through the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlight continues to search through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found her second victim over  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another flash!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very close on the girl's yellow purse... as the metal zip is pulled open. The driver notices her opening the purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay if I smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvincingly) ...sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver watches as she reaches into the purse... out a soggy pack of matches. She looks at them... I look to the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My matches are all wet. You got a  lighter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scans the dashboard) Yeah. It's here somewhere. It's my  wife's car. Ah... there it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the cigarette lighter in to heat. Out of the co of his eye, he sees the girl's hand slip back in her purs And stay there. She stares at the car lighter and... wait The driver glances at her, then back to the lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!! As another strobe light ignites. Tape recorder ha Brian continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lured them here with the promise  of sex. (beat) Imagine the anger and hatred she  must have felt returning to this  place. Did she use that to help her  pull the trigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie snaps another shot. Flash!! The blinding flash  illuminates the night rain streaming in through the fract remains of the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stops talking. Carrie scans the darkness. From the  quiet... A Thunderous Roar!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Blinding Flash!! As... a semi-trailer crosses paths with the 70'S CHEVY. Close on the girl. An intent expression on her face as sh watches and waits... for the cigarette lighter to eject. hand reaches deeper into her purse. The Driver tenses as sees this. Suddenly... POP!! The lighter ejects. The Driver reaches for the dash. The girl hurriedly lifts something out from inside the bag. The Driver yanks the  lighter out... and whips a look to the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's flashlight sweeps across the shadowed remains of rafters and catwalks. Scanning... Listening... Brian and  Carrie glance tentatively at each other... Then slowly Ca lifts the portable strobe unit upward until it is pointin into the rafters. Carrie fires a shot, triggering a brill Flash!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash! Out of the inky black... The glistening wet rock  emerges, hurtling downwards... Tumbling end over end thro the night rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl pulls a pack of cigarettes out of her purse. She looks curiously to the driver whose hand is trembling  slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvincingly) ...nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl reaches out, steadies his trembling hand... and  pulls the red hot coil to the cigarette between her lips. When... in a THUNDEROUS CRASH!! The glistening wet rock c smashing through their windshield!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHEVY brakes... Skids across the rain-slicked pavemen and turns a somersault, landing upside down on its hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA DRIFTS ACROSS the fractured front end of the  overturned CHEVY. The twisted hunk of metal hisses...  steams... groans. The front tire spins lazily to a halt o its mangled axle.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACKGROUND
dialogues.text: We see a man standing on a highway overpass. He's leaning the railing and calmly looking down at the wrecked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EARLY GRAYCE, 25, athletic build, big watery eyes, jet bl hair, stands by the railing. Rain streaks down his  expressionless face. He dropped the rock.

dialogues.speaker: THE 70'S CHEVY
dialogues.text: Lying in the deserted highway. The Driver crawls out cove with blood. Still clutched in his hand is the car cigaret lighter. Its red hot coil extinguishing quickly to a fain glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calmly looking down with no pity. Even closer... Water ru down his face. Closer yet... On his eye... And right into the dilated pupil. As we enter it -- it's like being in a dark winding tunne filled with the hum of dynamos and the loud rhythmic pump of powerful machinery.

dialogues.speaker: FROM SOMEWHERE IN THE BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: The distant echo of a Woman's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you dead or alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still hearing the whine from some tremendous dynamo, we e from the inside of BRIAN'S RIGHT EARDRUM, pulling back fa enough to see his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is distracted, distant, not paying attention to the game of "Twenty Questions" that he is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Obviously!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small party in progress. Graduate student types, smokin drinking. The usual. Carrie and Brian stand out in this g their look is more stylized, their attitude less complace Carrie, in particular, looks restless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man or woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie tunes in and pays attention to the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real or fictional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted Bundy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's eyes dart to Carrie. The look on his face tells  everyone she nailed it. Brian gets up to get another drin Several people laugh, amazed that Carrie knows Brian so w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a guess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't count, she's disqualified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you've been living with him,  and his thesis for the last year and  a half. (beat) He's probably been researching Ted  Bundy all week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, you are the world's worst loser!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks over to Carrie. She gives him the finger and a cheeky smile. CAROL, sitting next to Carrie, asks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from that gallery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Apprehensive. Let's not forget  these are the people who banned the  Mapplethorpe show. Anyway,  California's loaded with galleries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods toward Brian) You mean 'Ted Bundy's' finally agreed  to leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie watches Brian disappear into another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Soon as he finishes his thesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Eric's been "finishing" his  for over three years now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie lights a cigarette. Her frustration is showing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well Brian's got 'til the end  of the summer, then I'm outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and begins weaving her way through the crowde room. Carol follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I just can't see you  veggin' out in LA-LA LAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know... I think that  once I dye my hair blonde, buy a  string bikini and cultivate that  tan... I could be veggin' out with  the best of 'em... (does a valley- girl/beach bunny) Like fer shurr!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Carol share a strained laugh.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room's crowded with people. There's a lot of noise -- "shop talk," banter. Clipped conversations overlap, as we find Brian with his friend Eric. They are in the midst of making a blender of margaritas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about the mind and  culpability of a serial killer.  Someone who has no ability to  distinguish between right and wrong  should not be imprisoned, let alone  executed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric dumps in a handful of ice cubes as Brian pours in th booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here we go again. Let's just lay  it all at the altar of misfiring  synapses, amok biochemicals and  horrendous childhoods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's a fact, most of these  people suffer from a severe chemical  brain imbalance. (beat) That enough Tequila?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian pours in the rest of the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eric) The answer is research and treatment  under hospital supervised conditions,  not the electric chair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric looks for triple sec in the cupboards. PETER overhea them on his way to the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, until it's your mother's head  they find in the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls open the refrigerator door and grabs two beers.  Carrie steps up behind Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Executing the killer wouldn't bring  my mother back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian turns to see Carrie now behind him. She wraps her a around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic to Carrie) Ha, ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it'd sure make you feel  better, wouldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wouldn't make me feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter finds triple sec in the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Looking for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric takes the triple sec from Peter and pours some in th blender. He turns it on. It whines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) If I have to listen to one more  "tweed" talk about his dissertation,  I'm going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) Label it anyway you want, the bottom  line is these people are evil, plain  and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing with Eric) Okay, now you want to talk about  good versus evil? Well then let's  start with Adam and Eve and the snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do I have to blow to get out of  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reconsiders) A... I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A relic from the fifties with large glass windows. The ra has stopped but the streets are still wet. Early's piece shit Grand Prix pulls into the lot. He gets out and walks into the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is almost empty. Early, still wet from the rain walks to the counter and sits down. He calls out to the  kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee and a bowl of chili, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only other customer is an OLD MAN, sitting at the cou nearby nursing a cup of coffee. His face half hidden unde rain soaked hat. Early selects a tune from the countertop juke box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of his eye he sees a bug (from the conc block) crawl out of Early's sleeve and onto the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from beneath his  shadowy brim...) The Antichrist'll be a woman, in a  man's body. Seven heads and seven  tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early gazes at the Old Man curiously, then calls out to t waitress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make that to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early notices the small bug crawling across the counter. leans closer to it and watches it. After a moment, he THW it off the counter with his thumb and finger. The bug lan on the hot iron griddle with a SIZZLE! EARLY glances at the Old Man again... then scoots over on stool closer to him. Early seems curious to want to get a glimpse under the brim of the Old Man's hat.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK KITCHEN AREA
dialogues.text: The waitress is bagging Early's order to go... when the f door slams shut!

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DINING AREA
dialogues.text: The waitress re-enters the room. It's empty. Neither the Man nor Early are there. With Early's food in hand, she m her way along the rear of the counter toward the front do She glances around curiously. On the griddle, the remains something black and charred smoulders. Closer to the entr she stares at the front door. The sign that hangs in its  window has been turned... the backside which faces her re

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: She wonders about the sign for a moment, then stares curi out the window... not a soul in sight. She locks the door and begins closing up for the night. She turns to make he way to the rear of the diner then notices something. Slow she moves along the side wall, past a number of highbacke booths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on one of the funky old leather seats in a booth a pair of RED HIGH HEELED SHOES (the same pair worn earli by the Pretty Teenage Girl). The Waitress glances nervous about the interior. No one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: She reaches down slowly and picks up the pair of shoes. L at them closely. Stares at the inside lining. Then sudden out of the quiet... a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Size 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress spins a startled look to the booth beyond he Early leans out from behind the highback partition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right ain't it, size 6?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress... smiles, nods shyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early, you are so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ADELE CORNERS. She's 17, pretty, uneducated and  Early's girlfriend. She steps over to him, gives him a ki then sits down on the seat across from him. She starts to try on her new shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel kind of like the wizard of  oz, you know when she gets the red  shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Dorothy, why don't you hand me  that chili there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes the bag to Early. He digs in. Between bites, h glances over to Adele who's enthusiastically pulling on t new shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door swings open spilling light into a darkened room. B and Carrie, a little drunk, return home from the party. Their apartment is in an old converted industrial buildin in a funky low rent part of town. Brian walks ahead, Carrie trails behind him, peeling off clothes. She begins unzipping her dress, unnoticed by Bri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight turned out to be pretty  interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a leather cap that sits on a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warehouse. I'm not that drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was definitely the high point of  the evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's dress falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting excited) Just being there where it really  happened. It was different... more  visceral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm... I love it when you talk like  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is at the foot of the bed, he turns to see... Carri has transformed. She has stripped down to her black bra a panties, fishnet stockings, a nightporter style leather c A surprised Brian stands there a moment. Looking at Carri She looks great.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Carrie pushes Brian back onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Carrie climbs on top of him. She kisses his neck. Slowly  starts working her lips across his chest and down his sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A solitary trailer sits alongside a run down house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the soot tinged atmosphere, sunlight filters in p the curtained windows. Early is lying face down in bed, h right arm extended over the side. Adele is in the kitchen half dressed, and unsuccessfully attempting to iron one o Early's shirts. She realizes the iron is out of water, sh sets it down and steps to the sink and fills a glass with water. As she does she glances at a cactus on the counter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thirsty Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: She waters her small cactus (Lucy).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet that feels good, don't it?

dialogues.speaker: THE REFRIGERATOR
dialogues.text: Adele smiles then notices that a photo held to the fridge a decorative magnet has fallen to the floor. She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if that ain't Momma's little  angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele puts it back onto the fridge. It is a photo of a yo Early with his mother. In the photo Early appears to be a ten or eleven. he stands next to his mother. Her arm is d over his shoulders, she is holding a drink. A cigarette b dangles between her fingers. Nearby a portable radio is t to music, when the local radio jingle comes on and segues the news.

dialogues.speaker: EARLY
dialogues.text: A handkerchief bandana is tied around his head and over h eyes. The NEWSCASTER'S voice gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...two more victims last night, when  a twenty pound rock smashed through  the windshield of their car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly he reaches to his face and lifts the bandana up of one eye. Even closer on his left eyelid. It flutters... p open and blinks. Now... his eyeball stares right at us. T pitch black pupil contracts in the morning light. The  newscaster's voice continues to amplify...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was the third such attack in  the past month and while an extensive  police operation is underway... no  arrests have yet been made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newscaster's voice quickly fades away. Early calmly c his eyes and drifts back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early emerges from the trailer drinking a bottle of beer. looks around the yard, it's full of various kinds of usel junk. He walks over to his car. Adele appears in the door of the trailer in her bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances around to make certain that no one's looking, then 'flashes' her body to Early with a giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early smiles. Adele turns back into the trailer then,  remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I forgot to tell you, Mr.  Diebold was by again yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks at the run down house next door where Diebold lives. A beat up red pick-up is parked in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said, if he ain't got the rest of  his money by the end of the month,  he's gonna "kick us the... (spells the word fuck  to avoid saying it) F-U-C-K outta here."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early works his jaw, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that, huh? Cursed in front  of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early gets in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he comes back, don't answer the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early revs the raspy engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose he hears me inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele's words are unheard as Early pulls away flinging hi beer bottle at a couple of chained PITBULLS in Diebold's  front yard.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian enters the darkened loft interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked up some Chinese. Did you  hear from the gallery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian turns the corner, he's immediately greeted by a ser of erotic images being projected on the far wall. They ar slides of Carrie's photographic work. In regard to the na and content of Carrie's photographic work, her photograph address the sexual collision of opposites. "What if's." T subjects of her photographs are hypothetical and highly  unlikely partners. Studies in contract. Moments of passio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentative) You got your slides back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the room, he hears Carrie's disembodied voice He drifts toward the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, same old shit. Too graphic...  not suitable for mass consumption...  one of those... I forget. Who cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian finds her slumped down on the couch. He sits down.  She's got a drink in her hand. A bottle on her lap. She  continues to click through the slides. As she rambles on, it's obvious that she's definitely under the influence of something 90 proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ Brian I'm dying here... you  are too, you just don't know it yet.  You're too busy working on that damned  thesis... And, thing is... when you  finally do finish it, it's just gonna  get filed away on some shelf at the  University Library... then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian can see she's upset. Drowsy from the booze. He just watches her. Listens. Her words linger in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) I thought you wanted to be a writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) ...I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you can write anywhere. Let's  get out of here, while we still can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, come on... we can leave  anytime we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we can't. We can never leave once  you start talking about tenure...  and vacation pay... and parking  privileges and... oh shit! let's  just go to California now, right  now, before it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that. Load up the Lincoln...  point it West... stop when we hit  the fucking ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bold graphic sexual photographs of Carrie's continue accentuate her comments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's half the kick anyway. Doing  something you've never done before.  Experiencing something... different.  Something... unpredictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian notices an envelope on the floor nearby. He picks i up. Opens it. Inside, he finds the photographs Carrie too at the warehouse. Interested, he shuffles through them. H becomes more and more intrigued with what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...These are great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances over to Carrie... she's fallen asleep. He reac over and quietly pulls the drink glass from her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early's Grand Prix has a head of steam up as it tears acr the drive and hangs a hard right into his parking space n to the trailer. Suddenly, Early hits the brakes hard! Ano car is parked there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early spills through the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele, who's car's that out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early spots his PAROLE OFFICER standing in the bedroom ar snooping around. He has a prosthetic hand which he uses t search through Early's things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Parole Officer hiccups throughout the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' here? I ain't  supposed to be at the Parole Office  'til tomorrow, two o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early notices the man looking through some of his letters and papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Parole Officer opens one of the closet doors, pilfers through things inside, as if searching for something. Ear is getting pissed off but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to call me when you  lose your job Early. I stopped by  the mirror factory today, you left  quite a mess behind there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't my fault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts his crudely bandaged middle finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It was dangerous there and they  treated me like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parole Officer steps over to the refrigerator, opens it,  snoops around inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallows a hiccup) Yeah... Well you never have been  'treated right'... Have you? (hiccup) Your father was pickin' on you when  he threw you out of the house for  stealing the tires off his truck.  The Marines misunderstood you when  they gave you that dishonorable  discharge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes with the refrigerator and continues his searc through the drawers and cabinets of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiccup) ...The police were way out of line  when they stopped you from beating  that bartender half to death. And no  doubt God'll be pickin' on you on  Judgement Day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't got nothing against God.  It's the people he let come into the  world... lot of them should have  been stopped at the door. What are  you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Parole Officer ignores the question. He steps up to a sink overflowing with dirty dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girlfriend of yours ain't much  for housekeeping, is she.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early dismisses the place with a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early opens the refrigerator, grabs a bottle of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe down to Texas... Probably get  some work on them offshore oil rigs.  Hear the pay's good... hell, the  weather's got to be better'n here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early sits down at the table. The Parole Officer steps ov to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You know  you can't leave the state. (hiccup) What you can do is get a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Parole Officer pulls a slip of paper from his shirt  pocket, sets it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be at this personnel office,  Friday, three o'clock sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Janitor's job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man... come on, I don't want no  janitor job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early lifts his beer for another drink. The Parole Office prosthetic hand snaps tight around the neck of the beer  bottle, just inches from Early's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't give two shits about  what you want or don't want... I'm  telling you to be there Friday, three  o'clock sharp or the sheriff will be  here for dinner. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that Early looks up at the man, almost defiantly, th stands up. The Parole Officer hiccups again. Early stares him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oughta think about putting a bag  over your head... Might cure them  hiccups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Parole Officer shakes his head in disgust and walks o of the trailer to his car.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN'S DESK IN ANOTHER PART OF LOFT APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Brian's in the midst of working his way through pages and pages of thesis notes scattered atop his desk. Using  chopsticks he shovels Chinese straight out of the carton he studies Carrie's warehouse photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we approach Brian from behind, moving closer, closer.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN'S DESK
dialogues.text: Carrie steps up behind him. She's rubbing her eyes, havin just awakened. A hangover beckons. Brian notices her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I didn't have the heart to wake  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I sat down with my tapes and  your photographs, which are great by  the way... and I started writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie grabs his container of Chinese and takes a few bit Listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I think it's the best stuff I've  done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie glances over his shoulder at his writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I think I know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was there. And for a moment  that night I understood how she came  to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) This mean your finally going to finish  your thesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, fuck the thesis. I think there's  a book here. Your photographs and my  research, together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A book on the warehouse murders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A book on some of the most infamous  murderers in America. I want to go  to where they lived and where they  killed and I want you to photograph  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian reaches down to the floor and pulls a large map of United States up and lays it out on his desk. He traces a route West. Along the way, specific locations have been  circled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm thinking is, we can drop  down through Tennessee, across  Arkansas and into Texas, from there  it's a straight shot into California. (pause) "We don't stop... until we hit the  fucking ocean."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about fucking time, Kessler!  I'd just about given up on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have enough money, but we'll  figure something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie steps up to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's either the best idea I've  had in a long time... or there's way  too much MSG in this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks at the container of Chinese in his hand. Carr takes it from him, sets it down on the road map. Kisses h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early exits the trailer and climbs into his Grand Prix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early tries to get the engine to tick over. Then... He se JOHN DIEBOLD, his landlord, emerge from his house and beg lumbering toward the Grand Prix. The two panting ugly-ass pitbulls trot alongside their master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Hold on a minute there boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early tries the engine again. Still won't start. Diebold, getting closer. The dogs are barking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamit, you're gonna settle up  that rent here and now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurriedly, Early tries the engine one more time. It start Grinning from ear to ear, Early pulls away before Diebold and his dogs reach him. Pissed, Diebold grabs a rock and hurls it, hitting Early' car. The car stops, dead in its tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had it with your bullshit boy.  I want my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks in the rear-view mirror and sees... Diebold  standing there confrontational. Early throws the gearshift into reverse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tires screeching, the car surges toward Diebold and the d Scared shitless... Diebold begins back peddling. Confused the pitbulls bark, then follow suit. Early laughs as he stalks Diebold. Diebold jumps out of the way of the Grand Prix just as it pulverizes his portable barbecue. Early shifts it into drive and barrels out of the drive.

dialogues.speaker: DIEBOLD
dialogues.text: As soon as the Grand Prix is out of sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hollering) You sonofabitch! Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, he turns to find Adele staring at him from the w of her trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! You tell him... I want  you both the fuck out of here by  Sunday or I'm gonna call the Police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele starts laughing, she tries to hide it with her hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You won't be laughing come Sunday  little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muttering to himself, he turns back toward his house. He  then notices what Adele is laughing at. One pitbull is tr to hump the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elvis! Get the fuck off him!

dialogues.speaker: ADELE
dialogues.text: Peering out at him from the trailer window laughing at th dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian pulls up in his BLACK '62 LINCOLN CONTINENTAL. The  suicide doors and leather interior have seen better days. Brian locks his car and walks into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian steps up to a large bulletin board. He sees several 'Ride-Share' notes to various cities on the board. He pin Ride-Share note onto the board. We see the note is headli in red - "CALIFORNIA"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they say one of these  days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian glances over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) ...the whole thing's going to slide  into the ocean... Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol peers over Brian's shoulder and reads the note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Looking for someone to take turns  at the wheel and share expenses...  on a week long cross country blue- highways tour of historic murder  sites..." (beat) You gotta be kidding. Who in their  right mind would want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian smiles at her and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching Brian walk  away) Like I said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the personnel office at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol turns to see Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points down the hall) First door on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away. Early's eye catches the bulletin board, h sees in bold red marker - "CALIFORNIA."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele steps out of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks carefully around the junk piles. It's dark; har to see. She comes to the edge of a deep dark hole and pee in... She can't see anything but hears the rustling of a  shovel digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early? You down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of digging stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from inside the hole) What's up Adele? Dinner ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment's hesitation, Early resumes his digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The digging stops again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me more about California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moonlight illuminates his face when he looks up at he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... for one thing... They think  faster out there, on account of all  that warm weather they got; cold  weather makes people stupid, that's  a fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that'd explain why there's  so many stupid people around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and in California you never  have to buy fruit 'cause it's all on  the trees everywhere you turn... (beat) ...and, 'course there ain't no speed  limit out there, and all drugs are  legal... And I heard your first  month's rent is free; state law. I  figure 'til we get settled we can  just move around month to month...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll we do out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... the very first thing we're  gonna do... is get us a couple of  six packs of Lucky Lager and climb  up on toppa' that famous Hollywood  sign and howl at the moon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early lets out a playful howl, as Adele looks up over her shoulder at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... I read once... Ain't  nothin' on that big old moon 'cept  some old golf balls those astronauts  left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull. That ain't right... Government  sends people there all the time,  just don't want us to know about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele smiles and begins walking back to the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be long now, dinner's 'bout  ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Early climbs out of the hole and stands i the moonlight for a moment. We see that he's completely n except for a pair of high top steel toed work boots. Earl gazes up into the night sky, looking at the cold white mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian exits loft carrying two bags. Carrie is also carryi a bag, and smoking a cigarette, as they walk to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he sound like on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real polite. Kept calling me 'sir.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian throws the bags in the open trunk with the other ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think we should have met  them first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beggars can't be choosers. They were  the only ones who answered the ride  share note, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie bows her head and folds her hands in mock prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please God, we're gonna be stuck  with these people for a week, don't  let them be as boring as Brian's  friends. Anything... but that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian throws a needling glance to Carrie and slams the ca hood shut. They both get into the car, Brian behind the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah... He had a real thick accent  right outta "Deliverance." (quotes from the movie) "Still? Who said anything about a  still? Get ya ass up in them woods!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, very funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian starts the car. It backfires loudly startling Carri Brian laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quoting again) "Aintry? This river don't go to  Aintry."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine revs again and the Lincoln pulls away down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP from Adele's new red high-heeled shoes. We hear Ad speaking with an unfamiliar tone of authority to her voic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't be doin' this, Early.  You leavin' the state, ridin' around  with strangers... besides, what kinda  people would want to stop at places  where other people was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera slowly reveals Adele... and the fact that she alone as she voices her concerns. Then from behind her Ea approaches. Just in time to hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they're dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ain't dangerous Adele. They're  writers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Adele drops her shoulder bag. It lands on top o couple of cardboard boxes and a beat up old duffle bag -- all their possessions. A few personal items spill out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early Grayce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels down to pick things up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changes subject) Did you settle things with Mr.  Diebold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I left him with the car... We're  all squared up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Adele picks up her spilled personal possessions, Early notices her prized cactus in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He angrily reaches in and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for the cactus but misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a person would carry a  cactus in her purse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele bites her lip almost crying. Suddenly, Early looks  past Adele to see something, Adele turns too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln comes gliding into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield we see Early... Adele by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding me, they  look like Okies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian honks the horn, Early waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... They've probably got five  bucks between them. Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, they look kinda weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just smile, let me do all the  talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times you gonna tell me  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at Brian) As many times as it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stops the Lincoln and gets out. He approaches Early and shakes his hand, then Adele's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi I'm Brian... Early, and you must  be Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward moment as everyone just stands there... until  Brian reaches for Adele's bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian picks up her bag and carries it to the Lincoln. Ade is instantly won over by the gesture -- Early leery of it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie watches as Brian and Early carry their things to t trunk. Carrie leans forward and sets the trip odometer to zero. When she sits back up, Adele is standing at her win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reserved) Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shyly) I like your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie turns back, rolls down window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I said, I like your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and sees Early reflected in the side mirror wat her. He grins at her, Carrie looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian crams the last of the bags in, as Early watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks to him, Early grins and winks. Brian slams th Lincoln trunk lid shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the blackness... The camera rises from a pile of rub As it ascends we reveal Diebold's pitbulls howling and di at a mound of fresh earth where Early's hole used to be. The crackling flames of a nearby fire illuminate the scen Deep in the distance, the wail of approaching sirens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal that it's Early's trailer and car that are on fire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames consume the magazine photos of Elvis and Priscilla Farrah and Ryan, Early and Adele. Along with them, the bl and white photo of young Early and his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Lincoln as it exits the Bus Station. The camera  descends toward a lone trash can, to find there, lying am the debris inside... Adele's cactus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln passes through on its way out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian behind the wheel, Carrie riding shotgun. Early and  Adele are sitting in the back seat. An awkward silence  prevails. Brian clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, we can stop somewhere if you and  Adele haven't had time for breakfast,  Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's like this, Mr. Kessler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's like this, Bri'. I don't  eat much in the mornin', never have.  Maybe a beer once in a while; Lucky  Lager's my favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian raises his eyebrow a tad, but is not really curious about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because of what he read in a  book once... That folks needin'  breakfast is a myth, or whatever,  put out by those cereal people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glance passes between Brian and Carrie. Is she for real

dialogues.speaker: IN VANITY MIRROR
dialogues.text: Early motions Adele not to talk so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you do Early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I do some work up at the Merrick  Mirror factory, or I used to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night we figured out how much  bad luck he must have comin' from  all them mirrors he broke... (beat) Four hundred and ninety four years  to work it all off... After he dies,  he'll have to keep coming back to  earth over and over and over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele and early show no sign of understanding the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karma... (beat) You know, if you do something bad to  somebody fate will pay you back by  something bad happening to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That French ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie glances at the odometer on the dash... THE FIRST M clicks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone takes a last look at the familiar countryside. C is snapping photos of the twisting concrete overpasses an the gloomy grey sky beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele watches Carrie, intrigued by the obvious skill Carr shows with the camera. Brian glances into the rear-view m at Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Adele, did Early happen to mention  the places we'll be stopping at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ADELE'S REFLECTION IN MIRROR... then Early leans in fr of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Bri' I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele leans against Carrie's front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) Are you takin' the pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) ...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it hard to learn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early pulls Adele back toward the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) You gonna talk to the people who did  those murders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good idea. Unfortunately  most of them have been executed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln drives off down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police and Firemen sift through the smoking ruins of Earl trailer. The Parole Officer pulls up in his car, he gets and approaches a Police Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Parole Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, I talked to you on the phone.  They say it's a torch job, that sound  like your boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would we find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell if I know, crazy son of a bitch  said he was thinking of moving to  Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without his car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the smoldering remains of Early's Grand Prix. In t background Diebold's pitbulls are being dragged away by a Dog Wrangler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the owner of the house... (reads from note pad) ...this John Diebold, any idea where  he might be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I can tell you he's not gonna  be too happy about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside Early's hole we hear a voice call out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parole Officer and Police Officer turn back toward the  trailer, as people rush to the site.

dialogues.speaker: OVERHEAD
dialogues.text: The camera aerials down past those gathering around the  freshly dug hole to... a Laborer standing at the bottom o the pit. Alongside his shovel, we see that a man's arm ha been unearthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police and Parole Officer join several others standin there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Diebold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That'd be my guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like somebody cut off his ring  finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now I'd say that's the least of  Mr. Diebold's problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men look to one another... as others begin to une the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up, Diebold's ring on a hand twisting open a bottle cap. Pull back to reveal that it is Early as he opens a b of Lucky Lager beer and takes a sip. On the back seat bet them sits a brown paper bag. Adele reaches into the bag a pulls out a cheap pocket camera. Excitedly she rips open box and pulls out the camera. She leans over and kisses E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early reaches in the bag and pulls out a small plastic bo of mineral water and an orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, who gets the... (can't pronounce name) ...water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie turns around, Early hands her the water. Early lea forward and hands Brian the orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go Bri'. Got a couple a  bags of chips and some jerky, just  holler if you want some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Early reaches past Brian to the rear-view mirror and hangs a plastic St. Christopher statue around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do I owe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele struggles to understand the camera instructions on side of the box. She leans forward and shows Carrie her  camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Guess I don't know the first thing  about cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie deliberates her response for a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the first thing... is you need  film. Preferably black and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pulls a roll of film out of her bag and takes Adel camera to load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have any color film,  would ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a roll of color film out of her camera bag and  quickly snaps it into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like things in color, pink, purple,  and red. I dunno, black and white is  kinda... boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie points the camera at a smiling Adele and snaps the first picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just aim and press the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele takes the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele focuses her camera at the scenery out the side wind of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Pigeon Forge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Road sign to Pigeon Forge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele leans out the side rear window to get a better view

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of that! It's where Dolly  Parton has her park. "Dollywood". I  just think that's so clever.  Hollywood. Dollywood. Get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, she plops back down into the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Shush, Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early, can we stop there... just for  a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we see the car disappearing into the distance, we can  still hear Adele rambling on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I've always wanted to go there...  It could be such fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln approaches on a dirtroad and passes a mailbox with the name "BAXTER" on it. The Lincoln turns into the  long driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian begins talking into a small portable tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Novaks are all gone but the fence  that Michael Zaruba was hired to put  up is still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances to Carrie, who fires off several photos of the fence and yard. The Lincoln continues slowly down the long drive... Up ah through the windshield Brian sees a beautiful old farm ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Novaks embraced the young drifter  as one of their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln slows to a halt. Carrie and Brian exit the ca and begin walking toward the house. Early follows. Adele, uncertain about what's transpiring, trails behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Carrie turn to see... Adele training a camera o them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a smile now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Carrie look to one another then force a weak sm Early jumps in and throws a pair of devil's horns up behi Brian's unsuspecting head as... the shutter clicks. Brian and Carrie quickly turn their attention back on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues into tape  recorder) Neighbors said he was a quiet young  man, who was often seen pushing the  children on the swing set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unusual bird house and a tricycle sit in the front yar To the side of the house are the remains of an old swing  set. Carrie finds an interesting angle on the swing set,  with the house in the background, SNAP! She fires off a s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Everything was fine until the day  the family ran out of work for  Michael, and had to ask him to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carrie frames up another shot, Early crosses in front her camera. Realizing he is in Carrie's photo he stops an poses. Carrie looks to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Early... Could you step out  the way, for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early is surprised that they don't want him in the photog He wanders away from the front of the house. Meanwhile, A photographs the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first one to die was the nine  year old daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then... A NINE YEAR OLD GIRL comes running from arou the side of the house. She stops dead when she sees all o them. Carrie snaps a final photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl scans all their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My name's Brian, what's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl remains silent. Brian rolls a look to Car then back to the little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Could I speak to your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After an awkward pause, the little girl silently crosses yard to the porch and opens the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rudely) Pa! There's more of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking into the house through a kitchen window we can se into the entrance hall and through to the open front door Brian waits outside on the porch, as the little girl ente the house looking for her father. Inside the kitchen, rig next to the window, is a side table with a telephone and purse on it. Suddenly... Early's reflection appears in the window; he obviously seen the purse.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Brian motions for Carrie to join him.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SWING SET
dialogues.text: Adele watches Brian and Carrie for a moment, then loses  interest. She stands on the seat of the swing and begins  swinging.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE REAR OF THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Early tries to push up the kitchen window. It barely lift three inches before jamming. Through the room we see the  little girl and her father step to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MIDDLE AGED FARMER with tanned leathery skin. He is not happy. Brian extends his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) Hi, my name is Brian Kessler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father says nothing and does not respond to the exten hand. Brian retracts his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues -- less  confident) I'm a writer, I'm working on a book  about famous murderers.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SWING SET
dialogues.text: Adele swings higher. Her summer dress ripples in the wind smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early's entire arm is through the opening. His shoulder  presses against the window pane. But still he can't reach the purse. So, he grabs the tablecloth and begins pulling toward him. The purse slides closer, inch by inch. All th while, he keeps one eye on the Farmer across the room. EARLY'S POV (ACROSS THE ROOM) The Farmer's back is turned the kitchen as he listens silently to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm sure you're aware that this  is the Novak house...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SWING SET
dialogues.text: Adele swings even higher. She's lost in the moment. Eupho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (corrects himself) ...I mean, this was the Novak house... (pause) With your permission I'd like to  come in and photograph...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Brian can finish, the man slams the door in his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Farmer turns away from the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering) Goddamned ghouls...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: We see that Early and the purse have gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is surprised. He just stands there a moment. He's n sure whether to knock again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty swing sways back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Carrie walk back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) We could have been in and out of  there in less than ten minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I got some great stuff... it's  okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian continues on in a huff until Carrie breaks stride a stops. She pulls him next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay... okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian glances back at the house. She interrupts his glanc kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing on the  heel of the kiss) ...That house is part of American  history now, whether he likes it or  not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it Bri'. I wouldn't be  surprised if that Karma thing don't  come back and get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, surprised at Early's new found philosophical beli She looks into her side view mirror... And sees Early smi back at her. Carrie looks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shifts from the mirror to the house in the background... the car pulls out of the driveway, the little girl watche from her porch.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script. EXT. - LINCOLN PULLS UP TO MOTEL AND PARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small roadside diner. A fair number of people inside ha dinner. Adele, Early, Carrie, and Brian are seated at one the tables.

dialogues.speaker: AT THEIR TABLE
dialogues.text: Carrie watches Early eat with a kind of horrible, rude  fascination. He has no table manners at all. He eats with his elbows on the table, fork wedged in the fist of his r hand. All the while, he chews with his mouth open. He's  serious about his "eating."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying his map) Well we've come three hundred miles  so far. Not a bad day's haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early doesn't bother to respond. He keeps eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any family or friends in  California, Early?

dialogues.speaker: EARLY
dialogues.text: With a piece of bread he mops up the gravy on his plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chewing) Nope... You?

dialogues.speaker: THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Early's foot itches... He tries to scratch it but it does do any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. How 'bout you Carrie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: As Brian folds up the map. Early takes off his boot, then his well-worn sock. Carrie's look of disgust grows as Ear brings his foot up onto his lap and scratches it while he eats. Carrie puts her fork down: dinner is over for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well, least we got each other.  That's somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Brian looks up, sees Carrie's expression... Then what's  causing it... Early mops up the last bit of food on his p He notices Brian and Carrie staring at him and slowly put his foot back down on the floor -- then the sock. Brian picks up the check to see the total... Starts pulli his wallet out... Isn't quite sure how to bring up the ta to Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Bri', I'll get the next one. (prompts Adele) Think it's time we hit the sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early winks at Brian, Carrie catches the wink. Early and  Adele get up and head for the door. Adele waves goodnight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) Sweet dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Carrie, she is reflected in a mirror. Reveal, Ca wearing only a T-shirt is at the vanity angrily brushing teeth. In the bathroom next to her, a bath is running. In the adjacent bedroom, Brian is in the bed working on his  notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spits out a mouthful  of water) You mean because I object to having  somebody take off their shoe and  scratch their foot while I'm eating  I'm prejudiced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading notes) He can't help the way he was raised.  I kinda feel sorry for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pauses in brushing her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel sorry for him? Obviously you  didn't get a whiff of that sock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch, bitch, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Up yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie finishes brushing her teeth. Secretively she gives Brian the finger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...heard that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie glances at the bath water running in the tub. It's rusty brown and disgusting. She pulls the plug on the bat idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tap is running at the sink as Early empties the stole purse. He adds the last few coins to a small pile of cash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe thirty bucks for  this room... for what? A lumpy  mattress, that crummy TV and a  crapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early, sing me a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early continues to sift through all the items from the pu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele starts to sing a song.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Early start sing with her... As the song ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Hey can we go to that Chinese  restaurant when we get to Los Angeles?  You know, to see all them famous  footprints?

dialogues.speaker: ON EARLY IN BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Early reaches down into the bottom of the purse and pulls out a pair of glistening stainless steel scissors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if they let me put mine down  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at the scissors curiously, then switches off th bathroom light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Carrie, we're gonna be stuck  with these people for a week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click, a light is turned on. Revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian has turned on the nightstand light. He and Carrie a lying in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And all I'm saying is I think we  ought to try and get along with them.  That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try, I'm gonna pretend they're  with somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian turns the light off. From the blackness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty smooth how he stiffed us on  dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian switches the light back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't stiff us. He paid for the  gas remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence... Brian reaches out for the light... when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you he's nearly broke  and we're going to end up paying for  those two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian decides to leave the light on. He moves closer to  Carrie. He slides up against her backside. He reaches for her under the sheets. Kisses her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pushes her body up against his in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Um, maybe... maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's mouth moves down along her back. He slips beneath the sheets. From the expression on her face, she obviousl approves... Yet she can't resist slipping in another rema

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Um... Funky fucking sock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie rolls over on her back. Brian moves on top of her. Kisses her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and what's with that hair? Is  that grease or motor oil or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie reaches down and grabs two fists full of Brian's h She pulls him to her. He slides up along her chest, kissi her. Things heat up. She reaches out, grasps his arms. Pu him closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you believe that tattoo? Looks  like he had another girls name there  and carved it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian bites at her neck. She stops talking. His sweating  shoulder presses against her face. She turns her head to  encourage him. In the dresser mirror... she sees their shadowy reflectio Their bodies atangle under the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and that body odor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their reflection in the mirror intrigues her. Intoxicates her. His aggression excites her. She pulls him into her. metal bedframe bangs against the motel wall repeatedly as they make love. Then slowly, the camera bisects the plaster and lumber di and emerges in the next room...

dialogues.speaker: TO FIND
dialogues.text: Early leaning quietly against the same wall. Listening to them. As he does, he uses the scissors to cut through the crusty bandage on his finger. Then, across the room he no Adele in bed asleep... the scissors stop.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early exits his motel room, opens a bottle of Lucky Lager against a soda dispenser, and walks over to the motel din

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early enters the diner drinking his morning beer. Adele i not with him. He spots Brian and Carrie seated opposite o another in one of the booths. He walks up to their table drops down uninvited on the seat next to Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early lifts his beer bottle in salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bri'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Adele?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
