dialogues.text: She wasn't feeling so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS arrives with a menu, offers it to Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (burps) Nah... Don't eat breakfast. Never  have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress notices Early's bottle of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah sir... sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets Early's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) We ah... don't have a liquor license  here. So I'm afraid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't be, I got plenty more  where this one came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress gives him a curious look and walks away. Just then, Brian look past Early... A surprised expressio crosses Brian's face. Early turns to see... Adele approac the table. Her hair has been crudely chopped to resemble  Carrie's. It looks like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a loss for words) You cut your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele smiles, pleased with Carrie for noticing. She sits  down next to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early cut it. (smiles at Early) ...Once he gets an idea in his head  there's no holding him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie looks to Brian curiously. Adele is distracted by a small cactus on the window near the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice job Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie notices Adele's 'new' (stolen) purse... We see the wheels turning in Carrie's head. How? Where?

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early walks toward the Lincoln. It is parked outside Bria and Carrie's room. The front door is ajar, he pushes it o He sees Carrie's reflection in the bathroom mirror, she's her underwear, pulling on her jeans. Early watches her fo moment. There's no mistaking what's on his mind... as his eyes scan her body. Carrie pulls on her T-shirt, steps ou of the bathroom and sees Early just outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Need a hand with those bags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks, I can manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie turns back to the dresser and gathers up the last things. She glances into the dresser mirror looking for  Early's reflection at the door, but he's gone. Relieved, turns the corner to grab her bags and finds Early standin right there! Looking at her. He startles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up her bags and walks out of the room. Carrie wa him, then she steps to the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL
dialogues.text: Early places the bags in the Lincoln's trunk. Adele sees  Early carrying Carrie's bag, Adele looks jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foreground Carrie's door closes. TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln passes through frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian at wheel, Carrie next to him loading her camera. Ea in the back seat, Adele next to him pulls out some make u from her bag, we see the little cactus from the motel lob She begins to put on some lipstick. Early reaches into th frontseat and grabs the manuscript that sits between Bria and Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to read) This the book your writing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a work in progress, kinda  rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy killed a mess of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Lee Lucas. Well he was only  convicted of killing eleven but he  claimed to have killed over three  hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder what all them people done  made him so mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks to Early in his rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The front tire blows... the car lurches. Brian reacts, pu the Lincoln to the side of the road in a dusty halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Early unload the trunk to get to the spare tire

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RIGHT FRONT TIRE
dialogues.text: Brian struggles with the wheel and the jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here Bri' let me do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early takes over. He pulls off his shirt, jacks the car u and begins replacing the wheel with ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he get away with it for so  long anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He almost always killed strangers.  Spent years moving on from one place  to another. That made it real hard  to track him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie scans the landscape with her camera. She sees Adel walking around a small roadside graveyard. She is reading the epitaphs on the headstones. Carrie fires off a few sh Then she sees Early, she can't help but notice Early's le body. She zooms in on his muscles and prison tattoo. Clic Early completes the task. Together he and Brian begin put everything back in the trunk. Suddenly, from behind, Adele jumps onto Early's back,  surprising him. He gives her a "horsey ride" around the  Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: ON CARRIE
dialogues.text: She notices Early's wallet on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ON EARLY AND ADELE
dialogues.text: She's riding him, covering his eyes playfully.

dialogues.speaker: ON CARRIE
dialogues.text: She picks up the wallet.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE LINCOLN
dialogues.text: Early's feet galloping.

dialogues.speaker: ON CARRIE
dialogues.text: She opens the wallet to find two one dollar bills inside.

dialogues.speaker: WITH EARLY AND ADELE
dialogues.text: As they come around the side of the car and to a stop in  front of Carrie. She holds up his wallet... watches his e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dropped this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early Grayce if this ain't your lucky  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the wallet back to him. Something between them  goes unspoken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln pulls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's your turn to pay Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early nods and Brian looks over to Carrie, making sure sh heard. The four of them get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early starts toward the gas station store. He checks his  wallet, two dollars left. Carrie and Adele lean against t car. Carrie lights up a cigarette. She watches Early to s what his next move will be. Brian removes the gas cap and sticks the gas pump nozzle in. It pumps away.

dialogues.speaker: THE GAS METER
dialogues.text: It starts turning over... $$$$$ Click... Click... Click..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing the tarmac)... with Early. His face expressionl His mind racing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian walks around the Lincoln; checking the tires. Carri watches Early intently.

dialogues.speaker: EARLY
dialogues.text: He walks toward the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the store he sees a video surveillance camera. It  worries him. Distracts him momentarily. Suddenly from behind him... o.s. A car horn HONKS LOUDLY! Early turns to see a late model Mercedes behind him. He j gazes at the driver. Aggravated, the driver leans on the  horn and motions Early out of his way. Early stares at th man a moment longer, then steps to one side and lets the pull past him.

dialogues.speaker: THE GAS STATION
dialogues.text: A FAT MAN in his late thirties exits from behind the whee of the Mercedes. Early watches him as he takes a money cl from his pocket and walks toward the entrance to the mini market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gas meter dial continues to go around. $$$$$ Click... Click... Click...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls leaning against the car. Adele watches Carrie t a drag on her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to smoke before I met Early.  But he broke me of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her remark gets Carrie's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broke you?

dialogues.speaker: ON EARLY
dialogues.text: He watches the Fat Man inside the office.

dialogues.speaker: EXT./INT. GAS STATION
dialogues.text: The Fat Man pays THE ATTENDANT for gas and is handed the  restroom key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian walks to the front of the Lincoln. He passes Carrie and Adele...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early don't think women should smoke  or curse or drink liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't do any of those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie takes a quick look to the mini-market. She's lost  sight of Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better not, or Early'd whip me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Adele) He whips you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fat Man turns the key and enters the bathroom. The do starts to swing shut behind him, but... TWO FINGERS catch it before it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when I deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lifts the hood of the Lincoln... Reaches for the  radiator cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fat Man is standing at the urinal. He has a ureterost bag he's emptying, when... Early's hand hits the blow dryer. A whirring sound fills room. The Fat Man turns his head. Early lunges at him fro behind, yanks his head back and rips a switchblade across his throat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLAST of steam from the radiator startles Brian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fat Man clutches at his throat. Sees the blood on his palms. He looks up in shock. Early pounds the man's head  into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian checking the oil, pulls out the dip stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black oil runs down the metal blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fat Man falls to his knees against the urinal. His ha grasping the lever. The urinal flushes. Water flows. The Man's blood mixes with it. The urinal overflows. The bloo tinged water spills onto the white tile floor. Early prie the dead man's fist off the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian slams the Lincoln's hood shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early struggles to turn the fat corpse over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian steps up to the gas nozzle and pulls it out of the  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early reaches in the dead man's pocket and removes his mo clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gas meter stops turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early calmly washes his hands in the beat up ceramic sink He pulls a comb from his pocket and combs his hair in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian pulls a squeegee across the front windshield. Water washes the dirt away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloody water spiralling down the drain hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early exits the bathroom... and runs straight into Brian, about to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) Hey Bri'... ah... You don't want to  go in there. It's a real mess, if  you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian glances at the bathroom door. Down below, a thin st of the Fat Man's blood begins to trickle out from under t door... just barely touching the toe of Brian's shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Then some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early puts his arm around Brian and turns him back toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CAR
dialogues.text: Adele takes a photo of them, approaching. The attendant s up to Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) Comes to twenty eight dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie points to Early. As Brian and Early approach the c Early pulls out the money clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it an even thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early peels off thirty bucks from the money clip. He sees Carrie watching him, Early smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive Bri'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing that, Carrie climbs into the back seat. Adele cli over the backrest into the frontseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele, get in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs again into the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early is driving. Brian riding shotgun, is making some no in his manuscript. Adele is teaching a reluctant Carrie t play a card game called "SNAP."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Hey you're good. Thought you said  you never played before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't... I'm a fast learner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They never caught that Black Dolya  Killer, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dahlia, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people think it's because he  never killed again. He just  disappeared back into society.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't sound too convinced 'bout  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought it was the work of  a serial killer. Anyone who took  that much time and care bisecting  another human being must have been  enjoying it and would have done it  again. And again. Until someone  stopped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That your... "theory", ain't that  what they call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna hear mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie listens in as she continues to play cards with Ade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you goin' to record it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian picks up his tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into tape) Early Grayce, June twenty third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hands Early the hand held tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into tape) Well I'll just bet he's still alive.  Old, livin' in some trailer park or  somethin' somewhere, but still alive.  Thinkin' every night 'bout what he  done. Goin' over and over it in his  mind. How smart he was for getting  away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is chilled by the intensity of Early's remark. She watches him out of the corner of her eye. SMACK! Adele's  hand hits the pile of cards and she wins the game. Startl Carrie turns back to Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) You lose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Early) I suppose anything's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian puts one leg across the other and goes back to his  notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revealing... the blood encrusted toe of his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever play any pool Bri'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead a HONKY TONK BAR with a large sign "POOL TABLES, BOWLING & MUSIC"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln passes by the LARGE SIGN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hold my own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high angle looks down on the modest cluster of rooms be The motel sign pulses erratically in foreground. Moths fl about the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln is parked in front of Brian and Carrie's room The horn honks. Early is behind the wheel, engine running Brian steps out of the motel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Minnesota Fats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie appears at the door holding her camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Don't forget your key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Brian the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd I open my big mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian takes the key and walks to the car. Carrie sees Adele standing outside her door. Brian enters the Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adele) Why didn't you go with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you how Early feels 'bout a  woman drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you meet Early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie swings the camera around to Adele, and snaps off a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) I was hitchhiking' one day and he  picked me up. At first I wasn't gonna  get in on account of his car was in  such sorry shape. I said, "I ain't  never seen a white man drivin' a car  like this."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie snaps another shot of Adele. Every once in a while Adele feels like she should be "posing" for the shots tha Carrie's taking of her. So, occasionally, as she carries her conversation with Carrie, she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) An' he said right back, "You shouldn't  judge by appearances little lady...  this vehicle might just be a flying  saucer disguised as a car, for all  you know."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got in and we got to talkin',  and the next thing I know, I'd moved  in with him in this old trailer. (beat) Hey! Wouldn't it be something if we  all ended up sharing a house together  in California?

dialogues.speaker: ON CARRIE
dialogues.text: She lowers the camera from her eye and studies Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can fix that haircut for  you, if you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nondescript "joint" on the outskirts of town. American  cars. American pickup trucks parked outside. The Lincoln  pulls into foreground and parks. Early gets out of the Li and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if there's any "doors" out  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian exits the Lincoln and looks at Early questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... "openings" to other  dimensions. (pause) I read there are a lot of them out  West, mostly in the desert. They say  if you know what you're doing, you  can travel anywhere in the Universe  in a matter of seconds. Wouldn't  that come in handy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks at him blankly. He can't think of a thing to in response. Early walks toward the entrance of the bar.  Brian joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I'm not much of a pool  player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, it ain't hard to play pool. I  can teach you everything ya need ta  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah! I'll even spot ya a few  points first game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You're gonna hustle  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah... how much money have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh and enter the bar.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE'S MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Adele is sitting in a chair in front of the dresser mirro drinking a beer. Carrie is cutting her hair. In the mirro Adele watches Carrie for a moment. She notices the cigare dangling from her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you get your cigarette to  stay there like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie looks in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I try that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie takes out a fresh cigarette and hands it to Adele. Together they stare into the mirror with their dangling  cigarettes. Adele drops her cigarette, as she reaches dow for it she notices Carrie's portfolio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a portfolio of my work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pictures. Can I see 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele grabs the black leather binder and sets it in her l Carrie continues to cut Adele's hair. Adele opens the bin and takes a look at the first erotic image and slaps the  cover back down. She's embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie watches her in amusement. After a moment, Adele  reconsiders, and opens the book. She gazes at the shockin photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took this picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took 'em all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie resumes cutting Adele's hair. Adele thumbs through several photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it is not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Boy I'll tell ya, if Early  found a picture of me like that I'd  be black and blue for a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele notices Carrie's scowl in the dresser mirror. Carri stops cutting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly serious) You shouldn't let him do that to  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele... are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) You think Early's bad to me, don't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie starts cutting Adele's hair again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... You're wrong. I ain't saying  Early ain't never hit me... but he  never hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Carrie doesn't respond, Adele grabs Carrie's scissor hand and stops her from continuing. Carrie looks at Adele reflection in the dresser mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) ...When I was fourteen years old  three boys raped me in the back of a  truck, and beat me so bad I was in  bed for almost four months... (beat) ...I feel safe with Early, most the  time he treats me pretty good. And I  know he wouldn't let nothin' like  that ever happen to me again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is speechless, Adele looks in the mirror at her ne haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that ain't so bad now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrons are young men and women. Eighteen to thirty. River's Edge kids today. Leather. Ludes and Beer. Wasted. Rowdy. We follow one of the waitresses through the bar... As she passes by a pool table one of the players, A LARGE YOUNG  CRACKER, makes a grab at her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you gonna give me so o' that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spins safely out of his reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe when you grow up a little sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guys, close enough to hear her over the noise, laugh her put down. She moves on until she reaches... Brian standing near a small high table. Early's not with  him. She sets four beers down on the table. Brian tries t talk to her over the music. He leans in close. His mouth her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These aren't Lucky Lager, I ordered  Lucky Lager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry honey, 'ain't nothin Lucky  around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress laughs. Brian smiles and glances around the  room. He notices the Large Young Cracker staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Early steps out of the bathroom and makes his way back to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: He watches the waitress disappear into the crowd, then tu to find the Large Young Cracker in his face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say to her city boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Cracker is obviously very drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, I jus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) What's a jism gargling cum drunk  fairy like you looking at a pretty  girl like that for anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Cracker doesn't notice Early return from the  bathroom. He moves in next to Brian. Early is relaxed and nonchalant as he looks over the Young Cracker. He leans c to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of factly) You'd better hit him first Bri',  'cos it's comin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his eyes on Brian, Early grabs a beer. Brian is scar and confused, with one ear and one eye on the Young Crack the other on Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This yur' boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks at the beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Bri' this shit ain't Lucky Lager!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early takes a swig off the beer, grimaces and sprays it o It hits the Young Cracker. The Cracker looks down at his  shirt in shock. Early is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Early) Hey Asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is frozen, confused, doesn't know who to address. E continues to ignore the Young Cracker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't stock it here Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Early, furious) Why you fuckin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Cracker moves to hit Early. Early swiftly smash his beer bottle into the oncoming face. The Young Cracker doubles over clutching his face in agony. Early kicks him the face, sending the Young Cracker to the ground. Early  finishes him off with several more kicks from his heavy w boots. Two large tough guys approach Early and Brian. Brian's he racing, Early cool as a cucumber. Instead of taking on Ea they stop, reach down and drag the unconscious man away. waitress returns to their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that, he's always causing  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets down two beers and two shots, doubles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are on the house.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Adele split the last bottle of beer between th They are sitting on the floor and Adele has Carrie's foot her lap. She's painting Carrie's toenails bright red. Nei of them is feeling any pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My momma's a beautician. Guess that's  where I get it from. She wouldn't  hear of my moving in with Early...  on account of his just getting out  of jail and all. Ain't seen her in  nearly a year now. I wish she'd call  me, just once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) What's Early been in jail for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Carryin' a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An' resistin' arrest... At least  that's what the Police said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez... Adele!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele realizes she has said too much, looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better be goin'. It's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele hastily weaves her way out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stares down at her feet. Red toenails. Cottonballs between the toes.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early and Brian exit the bar. They make their way to the  Lincoln. On the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to see a man about a mule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks at Early, doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta take a piss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early branches off behind the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any reebs left in the back seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early starts to take a leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaahhhhh... (relief) That's what we used to call a beer  when we was kids... Beer spelled  backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian reaches in the back seat and grabs the last Lucky L He crosses to the other side of the car and hands Early t beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early stares at the last of the Lucky Lagers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well I probably drunk more than  my share, anyway... you go on an'  have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's all yours. It's on me...  for saving my ass back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early takes the beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's what buddies are for,  right...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early polishes off the rest of the bottle and heaves it i the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice drops almost  to a whisper) You know those doors I was talking  about? Found two of them back in  Kentucky. Shit, I wasn't even looking  for one the first time. Me and the  boys are just swingin' our sickles  by the side of the road, and I turned  around and there it was... this door  with this bright blinding white light  all around it... course I'm thinkin'  I must be sunstroked or somethin'...  so I close my eyes figurin' I'll  count ten and it'll be gone right...  so I'm countin'... (he closes his eyes) ...1-2-3-4-5... an' I'm 'bout ta  piss myself right... -6-7-8-9... 10.  An' I open my eyes slow, spectin' it  won't be there right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Early opens his eyes, he sees a concerned look on Br face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvincingly) ...and it wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence. Then Early starts laughing. Brian follows suit. They both climb back in the car. Their forced laughter trails off. Brian shifts the Lincoln back into gear and segues  awkwardly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you "swinging a sickle"  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early stares at Brian. For a moment Brian is unsure what  Early will say, or do? Then Early grins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For... 'bout three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian brakes their eye contact, looks back out onto the  highway and just drives off.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens revealing Brian silhouetted in the doorway Under the influence of Lucky Lager, he fumbles with the k gets inside and noisily shuts the door behind him. Carrie remains stonily silent, in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta see a man about a mule... What's  wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few seconds pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing that's been "wrong"  the whole trip. Your good buddy Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, in bed, switches on the side table light. Reveals Brian leaning on the wall trying to get his shoes off wit falling over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said he's my good buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure been acting like you were... (redneck accent) ...Out whoopin' it up, a drankin'  and ever' thang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian points to the empty beer bottles on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey come on, you two were drinking  too... so what's the big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian throws his shoes somewhere and heads toward the  bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and you should've seen how  terrified she was that he'd find  out. He beats her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me... (adding) ...but only when she "deserves" it.  Did you know he was in jail?

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Brian turns on the light. Takes a piss. A long one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, for stealing a car. Aaahhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, from right behind him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Brian turns to see Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He told her it was for carrying a  gun, but the truth could be murder  for all we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Brian. Carrie walks away.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Carrie steps over to the bed, pulls the sheets back. Bria leans out the bathroom door:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop being so fucking melodramatic!  If it was murder he'd still be locked  up or on parole, in which case he  wouldn't be allowed to leave the  state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he wasn't allowed to leave!  Geezus Brian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian smacks himself on the forehead (a sarcastic "how st of me!") He pulls his shirt off over his head, and admits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Of course! The accent, the clothes,  and those table manners!... He's got  to be a mass murderer! (pause) What else could he be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches off the bathroom light, steps out of the door and begins to pull his jeans off. Carrie climbs into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it wouldn't even surprise  me if he turned out to be... a  Republican!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian tosses his jeans and moves toward the bed. Carrie  switches off the the only light in the room. In the dark, hear a thud as Brian trips over a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!... my fucking toe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie leaves the motel room, ice bucket in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian inside room) Try not to lose consciousness 'til I  get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end of a narrow hallway, Carrie finds an ice  machine rumbling away noisily. The only illumination, a s fluorescent light bulb, hangs suspended above it.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ICE MACHINE
dialogues.text: With her arm buried inside the ice machine, Carrie scaven for what little ice there is... when, out of the corner o her eye, she notices... SOMEONE standing at the other end of the corridor. The  silhouette of a man. Carrie stops. Her eyes scan the claustrophobic hallway fo another way out. There is none. She tries to ignore the situation. Grabs another handful ice cubes. The man approaches. Carrie stops again. Her mi races. The man's face slowly becomes visible as he nears fluorescent light. It's Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you done enough drinking for  tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Brian hurt his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early reaches past her into the ice machine and grabs a  solitary cube. He puts it in his mouth, sucks on it. His  torso is drenched in sweat. He catches Carrie staring at  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes... Don't know why it is...  I get so hot I can't stand it. I  just start sweating like a dog. You  ever get like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenuous) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early spits the ice cube back into his hand. He presses i against the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can feel it start to run down my  neck... (he turns his back to  show her) ...and down my back... right into my  pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie follows a bead of ice water as it slides down betw his shoulder blades and along his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and everything starts stickin'  together... keeps running down the  back of my legs like two rivers racin'  for my boots, see who gets there  first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps a look back to Carrie and finds her looking at h ass. She diverts her glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never get that hot, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie shakes her head no. Early looks in his hand to see that his ice cube has melted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get back before this ice  melts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie tries to slip past him. He reaches back into the  machine, momentarily blocking her exit. He grabs another cube. His face only inches from hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...never?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, never. Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the ice cube in his mouth and lets her pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like Skynard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response, Early chews up the ice cube.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car crawls out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is driving. Brian is contending with a major hango There is still a silent tension between Brian and Carrie  from the argument the night before. Early is in the back  with Adele. Brian moves his head and moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy always took sauerkraut juice  and tobasco sauce for a hangover,  mixed in one egg not two, and some  tomato juice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the front seat, Brian's hand springs up in a despera plea for an end to Adele's colorful description.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian rolls down his window for some fresh air, as the ca pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie glances over at Brian, who is now asleep next to h She looks up into her rear-view mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early is asleep, leaning against the door. Adele is rumma through a large canvas bag on the seat next to her.  Suddenly... The wail of an approaching ambulance gets Car attention. It roars by. Carrie glances in the mirror agai The next instant, unexpectedly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She furiously pulls the car off the road to an abrupt hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's heads bangs against the side window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie nods toward the back seat. Brian turns and sees Ad looking back at them questioningly. Beside her, Early rus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian notices that Adele's rummaging has revealed an auto pistol in the open canvas bag. Brian stares at it. Early' eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted plain. It's very quiet here. Until the silence broken by the sound of gunshots. Reveal Early teaching Br how to shoot. A row of tin cans are set up on a rusty old car. It's obvious that Brian's enthralled with the idea o shooting the gun. Even if he isn't hitting anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only thing my old man ever gave me  is that goddamn .45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian fires off another shot, misses again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bri', you're jerkin' it when you  pull the trigger, hold it real steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby stands an unhappy Carrie. Adele pulls her yoyo out her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys'll be boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie doesn't respond. Adele offers the yoyo to Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know any tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie shakes her head no. Adele withdraws her offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna learn some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again Carrie declines. Her steely gaze returns to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: ON EARLY AND BRIAN
dialogues.text: Early helps Brian to hold the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady... Breath in... now let half  of it out, and... fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!! The can flies off the tree stump. Brian turns to C to see her reaction... but she's already on her way back the car, and she's furious. Concerned, Brian starts to fo after her... But Early grabs his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bri, I want you to keep this gun...  consider it a present. Never know,  California could turn out to be a  dangerous place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian gazes at the gun resting in the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln rolling along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is driving. Carrie keeps to herself. In her side mi she catches a glimpse of Early curled up in Adele's lap. watches a moment longer... and realizes that they are mak out. Beginning to kiss and touch one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln turns off the main highway onto a dirt road. the distance, we see a large rundown building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln pulls up to the ramshackle structure. Brian  glances to the back seat to make a remark to Early and Ad and sees that they are amorously engaged. Brian and Carrie start to gather their stuff. Carrie open the glove compartment, inside are boxes of film... and th .45 automatic. She takes a few packs of film, and closes glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell ya Bri., I'm still a little  sleepy,... think Adele and me are  gonna take us a fiesta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off) Siesta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie reaches over and takes the keys from the ignition, locks the glove compartment and pockets the key. Both she and Brian exit the car. As they start to walk toward the  structure Brian hears a sound, he turns back to see. Adel leaning forward into the frontseat as the lincoln's big w top starts to come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in daylight, the interior of the dilapidated old bui is equal parts unnerving, austere, and menacing. The last rays of sunlight stream through what remains of the windo The light falls on a long ominous row of wicked looking m hooks hanging from the ceiling. Carrie is getting her camera equipment ready. She's quiet and uncommunicative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE, on a small audio cassette player as it comes to re on a giant butcher block table in the center of the room. Brian pops a cassette in the player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A copy of a tape they found. He  recorded everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera in hand, Carrie begins to move about, despite the  fact that this place repels her. Brian presses a button on the audio cassette player. The  small tinny speaker plays a bad recording of something we slowly come to realize is the unmistakable sounds of a wo being tortured and pleading for her life.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Carrie fires off a series of shots from different angles. Brian scans the place trying to imagine what happened. Sc from the audio tape bounce off the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaks into his small  hand held tape  recorder) His mother had him working in here  before he was eight years old...  killing animals with a sledgehammer  that was bigger than he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Carrie walk through the remains of a doorway in another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she was pissed at him, she'd  beat the shit out of him and lock  him in here overnight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pleas for help and screams on the tape subside to a s whimpering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...Eventually the boy wakes up one  morning, picks up that sledgehammer  and starts hurting back.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Carrie takes a few more shots of the ominous interior. Th she stops, turns and walks out of the room. She's had eno Brian follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stops to pick up the rest of her gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... I know you're pissed off  about the gun, and I don't blame  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie wheels around to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, I'm not pissed off. God damm  it, turn that thing off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She switches off the cassette player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared. A week ago you would  never have even thought to pick up  that gun. This afternoon you're out  there wielding it around like Clyde  fucking Barrow, for Christ's sake!  What's with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it was a cheap thrill, it was  stupid, I admit it, alright? (pause) But let's not blow this. Not now...  Let's just get the photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I agreed to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, don't give me that shit...  you wanted to take these photos as  much as I wanted you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong! I was willing to do whatever  it took to get you up off your ass  and on the way to California...  There's a big difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie storms out of the place. She exits the tunnel, and makes her way toward...

dialogues.speaker: THE LINCOLN
dialogues.text: As she approaches it, through the rear windshield she see Early and Adele fucking wildly! Carrie wants to turn away, but she can't stop watching th Fascinated, she raises the camera to her eye and zooms in them.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH CARRIE'S CAMERA LENS
dialogues.text: Early is sitting against the back seat. Adele is straddli him. Carrie's finger finds the shutter button. Early's arms move up under Adele's dress... Her hands pre up against the roof. She's trembling... Wavering... Carri finger presses down on the button, CLICK!! Then in one swift movement Early sweeps Adele onto the ba seat. Close on Early's face. He's sweating... Lips moving Talking dirty to Adele. Keeping her finger on the button, Carrie rapid fires thro a whole roll of film. She's oblivious to the whine of the motor drive once all the film is shot out. Then unexpectedly!! Early looks directly into the camera, Carrie. And smiles... And continues to fuck Adele. A chill rushes through Carrie, she almost drops the camer She runs back toward the tunnel... and right into Brian's arms. He startles her. She pulls away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian I want him out of our car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, what did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian get him out of the car. Next  gas station either he leaves or I  do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln passes through frame. In the background, the  surreal image of an industrial complex bathed in an eerie artificial light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An electrical storm is in full swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln barely comes to a stop at the pumps before Ca storms out of the car and heads toward the gas station  interior. She leaves Brian to break the news to Adele and Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only person inside is a YOUNG MALE ATTENDANT. He's  watching TV behind the counter as Carrie enters. On the T we see a NEWSMAN. We only catch fragments of what he is s because the storm outside is affecting the TV reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty dollars in the tank and a  carton of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, each time the lightning flashes occur all of the electrical power at the station is affected. The fluoresc lights outside and inside begin to flicker and falter  sporadically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the ex-mental patient with a  history of arrests is still at  large...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static. Carrie looks at the TV, watches for a moment. It doesn't  hold her attention. She looks away and notices Adele leav the car. Adele walks toward a Coke machine at the other e of the gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your cigarettes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie turns back toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And change. Better be careful,  looks like a bad one coming. Where  you headin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear it never rains there. Must be  nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He buttons up his rain coat and goes out into the night t gas up the Lincoln. Carrie pulls a pack of cigarettes fro the carton, nervously lights one up. She looks out the wi toward the Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through flashes of lightning and thunder she sees Brian i the car talking to Early. Early listening quietly. Brian  looking adamant yet apologetic. The attendant fills the  Lincoln's tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simultaneously, as Carrie watches this... Behind her on t TV screen... A wave of interference scrambles the picture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we would like to repeat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there is a nationwide manhunt  for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The static clears and the Newscaster appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is believed responsible for the  murders of his landlord John  Diebold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's still talking -- using his hands to explain. Earl is watching him with a resigned expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A video tape image of a familiar gas station recorded by surveillance camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...of the fatal stabbing and robbery  of Mr. Joseph Davies Robbins...

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: She stares at the TV with growing horror as she notices a familiar black Lincoln in the background. In mid-ground, male figure approaches the video camera unknowingly. Slow Early's image becomes visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you see this man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie panics, turns toward the door and runs smack into arms of a dripping wet Early Grayce! Early stares at her drops his bag to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't ridin' in no bus... bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... Early notices himself on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...call your local police or FBI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static. Early grabs Carrie around the neck and yanks her into the back office. He pushes her down onto a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just sit there and keep your  mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He searches behind the cash register and finds a sawed-of shotgun. He shuts the TV off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew that boy'd have a hogleg here  somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant rushes back in from the pouring rain. Early points the sawed-off shotgun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early forces him into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit your ass down in that corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele enters the adjacent room. She checks out the variou vending machines in search of candy. Early taps on the wi and motions her into the office. She sees Carrie in the c scared to death, and Early aiming the gun at the Attendan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early, what're you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to the car and keep Brian  there. I don't want him in here... (beat) Do it Adele... Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele looks back at Carrie, then hurries out. Early empti the cash register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very scared) Walter Livesy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think. I might just have to kill you  Walter. How do you feel about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so good. You sure you have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Wish I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early, just think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele opens the door on the driver's side looking scared. Brian is in the passenger seat. He's looking in the glove compartment for a map. The .45 automatic Early gave Brian clearly visible. Adele stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele, what are you doing back here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele gets in and starts looking under the seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Lost my purse... Could you help  me look for it? It's probably under  the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant is reaching up, handing Early the money fro his pockets. Carrie is seated in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous shake) Vernon, Florida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of it, any huntin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turkey mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turkey's are real smart. Smarter  than most people think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early rips the phone out of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what Walter, you lie down  there now... You make sure you stay  put for a while after we leave...  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mind if I hold that Bible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need a Bible for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant has no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm goin' to kill you.  Well that'd make me a liar then  wouldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early takes the Bible off the desk and hands it down to t Attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frightened young man lies face down on his stomach  clutching the Bible and starts to pray. On the counter next to him Early notices a large stuffed  "happy face" display. "Free with every 20 gallon purchase He grabs one, stares at its face curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles to himself) I wonder if Adele would like one of  these? (beat) Nah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly... He puts the barrel of the gun between the "ha face" eyes... Points it at the back of the attendant's he Carrie begins to scream. Early pulls the trigger. The blast explodes the "happy face" and rips into the bac of the Attendant's head, killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thunderous crackle of lightning all but masks the gunsh The rain starts pouring down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele stares blankly back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room fills with billowing down stuffing. As the stuff floats to the floor it sticks to their hair, skin and  clothes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised at the  feathers) What the fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian opens the door to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early drags Carrie out of the office toward the car. Bria sees them running toward the car. They spill into the bac seat. Brian sees Carrie is upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, what's wrong? (to Early) Early, we went through this already,  you have to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the back seat Early wipes some more feathers from hi face, then points the Attendant's gun at Brian's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spits out a feather) 'Fraid not Bri'... Drive Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele starts the car. She pulls out of the station and in the rainstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the feathers fall like snow. The whole room i now white except for a red stain around the head of the d Attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car moves down the highway. Early in the back seat is still trying to brush away feathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to be an Indian-giver but I'm  gonna have to ask for my gun back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian reaches in the glove compartment. He removes the gu and hands it to Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Early) What happened back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits in the corner of the back seat, covered in  feathers but not even noticing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shot him in the head... oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele turns to the back of the car to face Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising her voice) He did not, you liar. Take that back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln swerves off onto the side of the road. Adele  looks to the front again and steers it back onto the high

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a killer, Brian... He's fucking  insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody just shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early picks some more feathers off himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two just cooperate and do what I  say, and we'll all arrive safe and  sound in California, as planned...  unless, of course, Adele don't kill  us first with her driving.

dialogues.speaker: EXTREME CU
dialogues.text: The St. Christopher statue swings from the rear-view mirr The windshield wipers sweep back and forth against the po rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln pulls up at the rear of the store. Adele exit carrying a couple of bags of Chinese take-out food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele enters the decrepit store. The others are inside. B and Carrie are tied up. Brian watches Early intently as h takes one of the bags from Adele. He begins opening one o the carry out containers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Chinese food. It was the only  place open. You said you was starving,  you'd eat anyth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early opens another container. Stares curiously at the  contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, they didn't speak too  good English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early sets the container down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just what exactly are the Chinese  doing here in the middle of the  American desert anyway?... Didja get  the beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele somewhat reluctantly hands Early a bottle of beer f a second bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..."Chink" beer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early notices that Brian is watching him intently. He mis Brian's interest for hunger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hell, I'm sorry Bri. Adele, honey,  untie Brian, he's starving over there. (pause) Carrie, you want some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie doesn't respond at all. Adele unties Brian. Early pulls out his gun, puts it on the table next to him Brian sits across from Early. He watches as Early rummage impatiently through the carry out paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the damn forks and spoons  at!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Early finally takes a gulp of Chinese food ri out of the container. It goes down rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Is it just me, or has this whole  trip been goin' downhill ever since  we ran outta Lucky Lager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian picks up a pair of chopsticks, then reconsiders, pu them back down and, like Early, gulps from the container. NEARBY, Carrie sits quietly. As she listens to the two me talk... she notices something on her arm. She lifts her a up to get a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees that a few of the white down feathers still clin to her. Closer... and she sees that one of the tiny feath is tinged with blood. The Gas Station Attendant's. It fre her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) How many people have you killed Early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early stops... thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ON CARRIE
dialogues.text: She tries to brush the bloodied feather away... but with hands bound, she can't reach it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now, how many people d'you see  me kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: ON CARRIE
dialogues.text: In quiet desperation, she raises her arm to her lips... a blows the solitary blood tinged reminder away.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIAN AND EARLY
dialogues.text: Early stares at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well then, that's how many I  killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvincingly) If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right I do.

dialogues.speaker: ON ADELE
dialogues.text: Adele watches the tiny down feather drift to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIAN AND EARLY
dialogues.text: Early picks up a different container and gulps some down. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never killed anyone have you  Bri'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never even seen anybody killed,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stops eating and looks at Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you getting at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early leans closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna tell me how'n the hell you  gonna write a book 'bout somethin'  you don't know nothin' 'bout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eye to eye, the two men stare at one another. Brian has n answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya see what I'm sayin'? (beat) Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously mimes the  same) ...Ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early goes back to gulping down his dinner. This time he  gets a spicy one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a nod toward the  carry out container) ...watch out for that stuff, it bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian gazes at the cluster of Chinese carry-out food  containers. An ironic reminder of an earlier conversation He lets out a weak ironic laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recollecting to  himself) ...way too much MSG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early is behind the wheel, not a care in the world. Adele sits beside him playing with her camera. She turns and ai the camera at Brian and Carrie in the back seat, their ha are bound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither makes any attempt at smiling. Adele snaps their p anyway. In the front seat, she sits quietly for a moment  then leans over to Early and whispers something to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I guarantee you he was  breathing when I walked outta there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele sits back quietly. Carrie wants to speak but doesn'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Ain't we getting near the  next murder site... Bri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it, doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell it don't... (beat) ...Hand me Brian's map there Adele.  One day I'm gonna pass some store  and see your book in the window. Me  and Adele gonna buy a copy for our  coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie silently fuming in the back seat. Brian stares at rope that binds his wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln drives down the dirt access road and stops. T all get out, Early unties Brian and Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured your hands might be starting  to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks down the hill to the old mine building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a look. You girls coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's steely gaze answers Early's question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just wait here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early leans into the car and picks up Adele's camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry Bri', I'll take the  pictures. (to Adele, with a  kiss to her cheek) ...you stay here with Carrie. (to Carrie) You run off... Bri' pays the price.  Karma, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pistol in hand, Early follows Brian down the hill. Adele  begins nervously playing with her yoyo. Carrie watches as Brian and Early disappear around a bend the dirt road. Out of the corner of her eye, she hones in Adele's yoyo. Adele becomes increasingly intense about manipulating the yoyo, controlling it. Until she's lost in it. A momentary refuge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is called walk the dog.

dialogues.speaker: EXTREME CU
dialogues.text: A huge excruciatingly tight shot of the yoyo in slow moti Its string unraveling as it spins downward. Carrie pulls gaze away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desolate surrounding landscape, a bright blue sky, th scrubbrush. And no one who can help them. Carrie turns an looks over her shoulder down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old mine building, rusted and deserted since the late '20's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me... what happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two brothers, prospectors, lived  here. Up until a few years back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash! -- Early takes a photo with the Instamatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coaxing) ...and?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They picked up hitchhikers... young  men... and brought them back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early scans the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd they do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly Brian leads Early toward the old mine buildin At the opening, Early hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele's yoyo skitters across the gravel road surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian turns back to Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't going to give me  nightmares, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then in a snap!... the yoyo recoils into Adele's palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distant empty ribbon of road.

dialogues.speaker: ON CARRIE
dialogues.text: Her eyes searching for anyone who could help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of my favorites... rock  the cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Early are silhouetted against the dying sky. Fl Early takes another photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They asked them just before they  were executed why they did it. They  said "to be famous." (beat) Why do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash!! Early takes a flash photo of Brian, momentarily  blinding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what Bri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early moves slowly toward Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know you didn't have to kill  that gas station attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's eyes dart nervously to the gun dangling in Early' palm. Flash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow motion Adele's hands manipulate the yoyo and stri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to. (beat) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash! Brian flinches. Early remains silent as he closes on Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It make you feel good? Powerful? (Flash!) Superior, what? Come on Early, tell  me something. (Flash!) Were you angry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early's boot lands toe to toe with Brian's shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentative) Who are you angry with Early... your  mother, your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eye to eye, the two men stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know about my daddy,  I'll tell you about my daddy, Bri...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks over to Adele at the car. Adele doesn't miss beat with her yoyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele, listen to me... Early's sick;  he should be in a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele screws up the trick. She pulls the yoyo off her fin and throws it in the back seat. She leans into the front  seat and cranks the radio up to the max. Closing her eyes she begins moving to the music, and tries to ignore Carri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over the  music) The police are after him, he's a  murderer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertain) ...That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back) That's not true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE CAR pulls into frame, unnoticed by Carrie and Ad in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call in the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Male Officer exits, unlocking his holster. The Female Officer picks up the police radio and calls in the licens plate number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio is blaring. Adele continues to dance despite  Carrie's pleas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) ...I wouldn't lie to you, Adele. . .  I saw him kill that man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) Early didn't kill nobody, he wouldn't  do that. I don't know why you're  saying those things. You ain't my  friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Adele stops her dancing and turns away from  Carrie... To see the Male Officer walking toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't say anything Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Male Officer continues toward them. It looks like he' talking to them... but his voice is inaudible under the  deafening radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Female Officer sticks her head out of the police car yells to her partner. He turns to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a match, I'll call for back  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Male Officer turns back, he sees Adele reach into front seat of the Lincoln. The Male Officer draws his rev and levels it at Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click! Adele shuts the radio off, total silence. As Adele leans back out of the car, she turns, facing directly int the barrel of the Male Officer's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right ladies, I want both of you  to slowly step away from the ca...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! A single gunshot rings out! The Male Officer jerks  back and falls to the ground. Adele screams! Carrie whips panicked glance around and sees... Early running toward t Brian, bewildered, follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead of him, he watches Early race past the wounded Male Officer. He kicks the Officer's revolver out of reach and rushes toward the police car. Early fires his gun repeatedly as he charges the car! The Female Officer pulls her gun and starts to get out of the car, when... a shot shatters the windshield hitting h in the chest. She collapses back onto the seat.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIAN
dialogues.text: He stops at the sight of the wounded Male Officer. Shocke he watches the man writhing in pain. His hands clutching crotch. His blood oozes into the dirt. Early approaches the police car. He sees the dead cop and hears the radio dispatcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer needs help, shots fired, six  Adam five, one eighty-seven, suspects  wanted in multiple murders. Location  unknown, last seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is not sure what to do. He looks around... sees the Officer's handgun lying in the dirt. He takes a step towa it, when... another gunshot rings out! Brian stops. Looks the police car. He sees Early standing there, smoke belch from the dashboard... the police radio is dead. Early walks back toward Brian and the others. He steps ov to the injured Male Officer on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me that don't hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early picks up the wounded cop's gun. He hands it to Bria as he trains the .45 automatic at Brian's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him. You'll be doing him a  favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks to Early in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early cocks the pistol and pushes the barrel to Brian's h Brian looks down at the wounded cop who is writhing in pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (No,) It's the answer to all them  questions of yers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian won't do it. He drops the gun to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early cocks his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Don't do it. Early, look at him,  look at his face. That's not your  father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early stares at the wounded cop's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. That there is a policeman  in a world of pain. And this is what  you call a mercy killin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early shoots the cop again. The cop lays still. Early reaches down and takes the dead cop's handcuffs. He casually points the little camera at the dead cop. Flash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln hurtles down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
