dialogues.text: Early driving. Adele in the passenger seat looks bewilder Carrie and Brian in back, handcuffed, eyes hollow with  exhaustion and fear. Then out of the quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele looks across the seat to Early. Her face drained of all expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Not so much as a simple "thank you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele at a loss. Finally... confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (empty) ...thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for what? (becoming aggravated) What are you thanking me for Adele?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly, she admits) ...I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Adele... it was for... (screaming at her) ...saving your fucking life back  there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrinks away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing with his  fingertips a fraction  apart) Darlin' you were 'bout that far from  spendin' the night at the morgue.  You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't going to shoot her, you  murdering son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks into the rear-view mirror. Brian tries to def the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie... stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explodes) What the fuck is wrong with you  Brian!? If you'll stop taking notes  for once and open your eyes... you'll  see that he is a homicidal fucking  killer. He is... for real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Carrie, please... just shut  up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln drives along an old deserted highway passing  occasional gas stations and dilapidated motels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early is driving. He notices something in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Off in the distance... an oasis of greenery.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A home in a secluded valley near the desert. It has a cac garden. The garden is illuminated so it can be enjoyed at night. Reveal... the Lincoln parked by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele gazes out the passenger-side window. She's enthrall by the sight of all the cacti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I luv' cactuses 'cos they're so  strong. Don't need much care really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal Brian handcuffed to the steering wheel beside her. cranes his neck to see out the rear window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early steps up to the front door of the house and rings t bell. Carrie stands beside him. A light comes on inside. door slides open a crack and MRS. MUSGRAVE, an attractive older woman with silver hair, peers out with a puzzled lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele rambles on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (far away) ...You can forget about 'em forever  and then look at 'em and they're  doin' even better than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching the house) Adele... we gotta do something before  Early kills someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Early and Carrie as they are let into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele is still rambling on about her interest in cacti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...There ain't nothin' can kill 'em.  They can live for two even three  hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele for god sake please lis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she glances over to  Brian) There ain't nothing we could do.  Once Early sets his mind on somethin',  well thats the end of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele drifts back to the cacti.

dialogues.speaker: A PORCELAIN CACTUS
dialogues.text: One of many we now reveal to be atop a fireplace mantle.  Adele leans in against the mantle and scrutinizes the cac Carrie and Brian sit on the floor, back to back, their ar bound around the leg of a piano by a pair of police handc Mrs. Musgrave is standing nearby. She's overwhelmed. Numb She pours herself a glass of bourbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) It's just like in that dream I had.  If only I had seen their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her drink and sits down on the couch nearby. Ad drops down quietly on the chair next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to cheer Mrs.  Musgrave up) You've got beautiful cactuses here,  I just love 'em. My momma used to  keep a garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Musgrave downs most of her drink with the first try. Distressed, her head slumps down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the kitchen) Hey Bri... You ever stop to think  that if you switched the two letters  in your name... (entering the room) ...it would spell Brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early, his pistol wedged in his belt, appears from the ki eating a sandwich. Between bites... He walks over and rip the phone out of the wall unit. He glimpses Mrs. Musgrave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sorry for her) She had a dream that somethin' like  this was gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early notices the glass of bourbon in her trembling hands He steps over to her and takes the glass away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets the glass down next to a recent picture of Mrs.  Musgrave and an ELDERLY MAN with silver hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) ...I'm a widow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks at her, he doesn't believe her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is quiet beneath the star studded sky. The sam elderly man pictured with Mrs. Musgrave is studying the s through a powerful telescope. MR. MUSGRAVE is an amateur  astronomer. o.s. the SOUND of a door opening. Then footst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Is that you Peaches? Come, you must  see Saturn tonight. The rings are  sensational!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early leans into frame, staring at the display case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside of it is a four foot long replica of the first ATO BOMB, "Fat Boy." Faded newspaper articles on the wall ind Mr. Musgrave had something to do with the bomb's initial  construction. An old photo on the bookshelf shows a much  younger Mr. Musgrave in a '50's kitchen. He is laughing a embracing a '50's style female mannequin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My oh my, this is quite rare, quite  rare indeed. Come have a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early's eyes drift over to a set of golf clubs that sit i the corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH TELESCOPE
dialogues.text: The planet Saturn and its glorious rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peaches?

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: THWACK!! The planet turns into a blur of light... then  blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Carrie are still cuffed to the piano, in the  background we see Mrs. Musgrave and Adele looking out the window into the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Carrie) You gotta talk to her. She looks up  to you, she'll listen to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried talking to her at the mine.  It didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then try again, (it's our only  chance.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early is leaning on a golf club looking through the teles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls his eye away as Adele arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Early, Mrs. Musgrave has the most  beautiful little guest house out  back and... well, no one's stayin'  in it... it's just empty. And she  said if me and you wanted to, well  maybe we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, o.s., a scream pierces the moment! Early and Adele turn toward the doorway to see Mrs. Musgr screaming. The older woman's eyes staring past Adele to t floor nearby. Adele follows the terrified woman's gaze to find... Mr. Musgrave's body lying on the floor. A bloodie wound in the back of his head. All of Adele's enthusiasm  drains from her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Musgrave) Well 'Peaches'... you're a widow  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Musgrave collapses to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Carrie are still cuffed to the piano. Across fr them, Early sits in an overstuffed chair looking through  Carrie's collection of erotic photography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) Have you seen this one? That don't  leave much to the imagination now  does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at another photograph. Confused, he turns it ups down, stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Musgrave is laid out on the couch. Adele, deep in  thought, watches over the older woman. Finally Adele reac into her purse, pulls out her small potted cactus then wa across the room to a table. Its top is covered with small potted cacti. She gently places hers among them.

dialogues.speaker: ON MRS. MUSGRAVE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Musgrave begins to regain consciousness. Her eyes op to find... Adele standing over her. Adele brings her fing to her lips -- Shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks through several more photos. He stops on one a nude woman's torso. Early looks at it for a moment... t extends the photo out toward Carrie, comparing it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles and shakes  his head in disbelief) That's you ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie doesn't answer him. Then, in the background direct behind Early... Adele and Mrs. Musgrave quietly appear. C notices them as they start to cross the hallway to the  kitchen. Early sees Carrie's eyes glance past him. He tur to see why... when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right Early...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early stops. Looks back to Carrie. Brian also turns to he curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It is me. Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks at the photo again. Adele and Mrs. Musgrave n cross safely to the kitchen. Carrie eyes meet Early's. He smiles, pulls the nude photo of her close to his face... licks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele quietly opens the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on now... please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Musgrave is confused, is it a trick? She looks into  Adele's eyes... and knows it's not. The old lady turns an walks out into the dark desert. Adele stands at the open  door, watching Mrs Musgrave escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) ...Call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early finishes looking through the photographs. He closes the cover of the portfolio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they say there's room fur all  kinds in California... and that's  where we're gonna be this time  tomorrow. California. (beat) Adele honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early enters, and sees Adele standing at the back door. A turns to face him. Early looks past her into the night an realizes what she's done. He strides across the room pull the pistol from his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE KITCHEN DOOR
dialogues.text: Early pushes Adele out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Peaches! Come on back here. There  ain't nothin' for you to be afraid  of.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CACTUS GARDEN
dialogues.text: Aside from the occasional pools of light illuminating the cacti, it's very dark. There's no sign of Mrs. Musgrave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps outside and starts firing his gun into the  blackness... bullets THUNK into the cacti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over the  gunfire) Nobody wants to hurt you Peaches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early! Stop!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperate, Adele grabs a large potted cactus. She rushes  toward Early. Swinging the cactus like an unwieldy bat, s pummels the side of his head. He stumbles forward,  disappearing into the darkness. Adele stands outside the  kitchen door, bewildered. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oww! Oww!! -- FUCK!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early re-emerges from the shadows. Adele's eyes widen whe she sees him. His cheek has long bloody gashes where the  cactus ripped the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed) Honey... What do you think you're  doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, n'jus what in hell you crying  'bout? I'm the one got hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind, Early. I'm not  gonna climb up that Hollywood sign  with you... I decided. I think your  mean, and you hurt people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look comes over Early's face that we've never seen befo That he's never felt before. Hurt. He doesn't know how to deal with it. And he definitely doesn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, watch for Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to try and lift the end of  the piano. If I can... slide your  cuffs free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie glues her eyes to the kitchen doorway. Brian press his back up under the belly of the piano and using all hi strength manages to lift the piano an inch off the floor. Carrie slides her cuffs out from under the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's eyes dart back toward the kitchen. Then she noti a chair nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you lift it again? Just lift it,  hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie grabs the chair. As Brian lifts the piano, she pus the chair beneath the underside of it. It holds the piano suspended an inch off the floor. Brian drops to the floor and slips the cuffs free. When... a solitary gunshot rings out from the cactus gard A moment later, Early steps quietly into the room. He's  pulling the last few cactus needles from his face. He see Brian and Carrie standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two been busy in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Adele?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's put it this way. (beat) I need me a new woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shocked silence. Brian and Carrie look to one another.  Carrie moves toward the kitchen but Early stops her! Bria rushes at him. Early sticks the .45 automatic in his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about this Bri...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to squeeze the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Early, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early stops. He looks to Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever you want. You want  me to go with you, I'll go with you.  Just don't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early deliberates the situation, then eases up off the  trigger... and smiles to Brian. Then, without warning, he hits Brian over the head with t butt of the .45 automatic. Brian falls to the floor  unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Early finishes tieing one of the replicant bombs, Litt Boy onto the hood. He reaches down and grabs a six pack o beer on the ground and shoves it in the back seat, then s into the driver's seat next to an anxious Carrie. Carrie now wearing one of Adele's floral dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think anyone will notice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie doesn't answer, Early laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early looks out over the expanse of the desert. He sees a dirt fire road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet there's a 'door' out there...  save us some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie doesn't understand what he means. Nonetheless, she nods her head in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln heads out, past the cactus garden, into the  darkness.

dialogues.speaker: THE LINCOLN'S HEADLIGHTS REVEAL
dialogues.text: Adele's lifeless body on the ground near her beloved cact

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is handcuffed on the floor. His eyes open slowly as begins to regain consciousness. He senses someone behind  him. He pivots around to see Mrs. Musgrave kneeling down help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, a cloud of dust reveals the Lincoln,  traveling at high speed along the dirt fire road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early still behind the wheel. Carrie sits up against the  passenger side door. She is tense and guarded. Out the wi nothing but empty desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass me a beer hon'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie quietly responds. She kneels on the front seat and reaches into the back. She grabs a bottle by its neck, an pulls it from the six pack of beer. Bottle in hand, she  hesitates a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early watches Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna hit me with that, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie reconsiders and sits back in the far corner of the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking at him) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the bottle to him. Early reaches out for the be but instead of taking it, he clasps his hand over hers. He looks at her and begins to squeeze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop lyin'... I can see right through  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early squeezes even harder -- Carrie begins to wince with pain. She waits for the glass bottle to shatter in her ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who d'ya think you're foolin'? (beat) I know you better than you think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) ...You're hurting me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early hits the brakes. The car screeches to a halt in a c of dust. Early squeezes on her hand even harder and begin to drag her toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen the way you been lookin' at  me since we met... Snappin' my photo  when you thought I wasn't lookin'.  Wanting me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie turns her head away. Early pulls her closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you when I killed that boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her hair with his other hand... Pulls her head a forcing her to look at him. Early has Carrie right up aga him, looking right into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) You were plenty hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explodes) You sick twisted fuck! You don't  know shit about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles trying to free herself. Early, his face onl inches from hers, smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sick... some people might say takin'  photos of me and Adele humpin' in  the back of the car is sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie struggles even harder, but Early tightens his hold

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I know I'd love to smash this  bottle right in your fucking face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly... Early releases Carrie, taking the beer from h Carrie retreats back into the corner of the passenger sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better... Honesty... I like  that in a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a grin, then opens the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'll tell ya... when we get to  California, we're gonna have to do  something 'bout that gutter mouth of  yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early takes a gulp of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early throws the bottle of beer out the window (it ain't  Lucky Lager), slams the Lincoln into "drive" and accelera along the dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pulled out all the lines. The  nearest phone is twenty miles east  of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian notices an old pickup truck parked outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anxious Brian hustles into the cab of the pickup truck Some tools are in the back. Brian still wears the handcuf around his wrists. Mrs. Musgrave stands near the front do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way did they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) He took the fire road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your car and get to that phone.  Call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian starts the pickup and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind has picked up. An old wooden gate blocks the fir road. On either side, barbed wire as far as the eye can s The Lincoln roars into frame and powers through the barri The gate smashes into splintered pieces of wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie leans against the passenger door. Early's eyes sca the open desert -- looking for the elusive 'doors.' Carri reaches for her pack of cigarettes. Early, without a word reaches out and takes the pack from her. He crumples it u and throws it out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's eyes go to the instrument panel. The temperature gauge is in the red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup truck arrives at a crossroads and skids to a h Brian tries to guess which direction to take. Then he spo Early's discarded beer bottle up ahead. The truck acceler straight ahead, tires spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winds continue to escalate, blowing harder and harder The Lincoln approaches on the fire road. A trail of steam streaming out from under the hood, blinding Early's view. Finally, Early slams on the brakes and skids 180 degrees a halt... Steam pours out of the Lincoln's grill. The Lin has had it. Early is indifferent and looks around. About a hundred ya away, barely visible through the growing sand storm, an o 1950's style building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early opens the back door. He grabs a box of supplies (so rope, a kerosene lamp etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie slowly begins to respond. She slides across the fr seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's hand crosses frame and pulls out a knob on the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is starting to set behind a distant mountain rang In the far distance... The pickup truck, revealed by its  trail of dust, crosses the vast landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early and Carrie struggle through the growing sand storm. Carrie throws a last curious glance back to the Lincoln a they reach the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door is kicked open. Early enters the room with Carrie in tow.

dialogues.speaker: EARLY
dialogues.text: He looks around the room... A smile forms on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, my name's Early Grayce and  this is my girl Carrie. I hope you  don't mind us bargin' in like this  but a... we was on our way to  California when our car broke down,  and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A living room fully decorated in '50's furniture. Sand co everything... Including... A FAMILY OF FOUR MANNEQUINS placed around the room: The f sits in front of the TV... The mother (the same mannequin in Mr. Musgrave's old picture) is toppled over a kitchen  counter... The little girl is seated at a table... The li boy is playing with his toy plane on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it's gettin' pretty rough  out there, so if it's all the same  to you, we'll be staying the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early slams the front door shut.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PULLS AWAY
dialogues.text: The building is a single story '50's home of extremely ch construction. It's in bad condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last rays of the setting sun reveal the pickup truck  heading toward the smashed remains of the wooden gate. Th pickup truck hurtles through the opening left by the Linc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a collapsed old wooden sign. It lies on the ground a f feet away from the gate posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind and sand blow freely through the remains of the wind A solitary kerosene lamp dimly illuminates the living roo area. Its flickering light finds... Early, stripped to th waist, crouched over the broken TV set. He fidgets with t knobs. Then the mangled rabbit ears antenna. Carrie sits some blankets in the corner next to the couch. She's scar to death. Her eyes scan the battered room. Debris everywh Amidst all of it, Carrie's erotic photographs have been p about the room.

dialogues.speaker: ON EARLY
dialogues.text: Still unable to get the TV to work, he smacks it a good o on the side. With the smack!... Carrie whips her look back toward Earl To find he's lost interest in the TV. He turns toward Car Stares at her for a moment. Then with a hint of a smile, begins to move toward her. The time has arrived. He reaches down, grabs her by the shirt and pulls her to feet. Carrie doesn't resist. He's rough with her as he ki her on the lips. Carrie pulls her mouth away from his. Sh seems confused, unsure of her feelings. Early watches her until her eyes come back to his. Then she steps forward  crowding her body against his, as she slips one hand arou his neck and kisses him deep and hard... Suddenly Early breaks the kiss and backhands Carrie hard  across the face. She lands on the floor several feet away the palm of her right hand is bleeding. Early looks down to his waist to find a large piece of gl protruding from his side. He pulls the glass shard out, blood drips down his side a onto his jeans. Carrie gets up and races into the back bedroom, frantical looking for a way out, there is none. On the bed the two  adult mannequins now lie naked. They have been placed,  intertwined in a grotesque sexual position. Carrie turns and rushes back toward the door. Early inter her and throws a punch to her stomach, which doubles her  over. Then Early sends a second punch to her face, she  stumbles backward, landing onto the bed amongst the  mannequins. Early begins undoing his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) You'll like it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A violent gust of wind sends several of the erotic photos swirling through the air. One of the photos whips across  Early's chest. The wind holds it there momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a lot, but you'll like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early peels Carrie's photo off him, the blood from his wo covers the back of it. He slaps it against the nearest wa It sticks. He walks toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high winds have turned into a full fledged sandstorm. Brian is still driving dangerously fast. The dim lights o the old pickup illuminate only a short stretch of dirt ro ahead and the swirling sand. He passes a road sign: 'DEVASTATION DRIVE' Then... As the pickup truck comes around a corner Suddenl directly in front of him -- Headlights!! Brian reacts... too late!! The pickup truck ploughs into the vehicle, and tumbles en over end through the open desert, before finally coming t an abrupt halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With each thrust of Early's body, Carrie's badly bruised  face contorts with pain and hatred

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sand blows in through the smashed windshield of the wreck pickup truck. Brian is upside down with his eyes shut. A  trickle of blood runs down his face. Camera booms up a di slope to reveal the Lincoln, beyond it on the hill above  sits the desert house. The glow of the kerosene lamp is  visible through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm is over... No sand blowing. No wind. No nothing

dialogues.speaker: COMPLETE SILENCE
dialogues.text: The dawn light reveals the devastated '50's house to be o of a cluster, set at the end of a 'Doom Town' cul-de-sac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkened bedroom, Early's solitary figure rustles  atop the bed. Slowly, he awakens. His eyes open. Across t bed, a pair of handcuffs is locked around the bedpost. In the other cuff is Carrie's motionless hand. Then, out of the corner of his eye, Early sees something one of the nearby rooms. Curious, he stands, shoves the . automatic in his waistband and walks toward the hallway. As he passes through the living room and enters the hallw his face contorts with a strange sense of wonderment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blinding light is shafting through cracks and broken ga around the front door frame... It looks like a magical "d shrouded in a wall of light!

dialogues.speaker: ON EARLY
dialogues.text: In disbelief he pulls his gaze away from the "door"... an sees through a window at the opposite end of the house... the morning sun rising. With that he turns his attention  back to the front door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew there was doors out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks toward the doorway of light. He grins as he open the "door" and steps through it. The sunlight momentarily blinding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black shadow hurtles toward him out of the brightness.. Eventually it blocks out all the light until... WHAAMM!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blow knocks Early back through the doorway. He slams to the ground, on his back. The gun falls from his jeans and slides across the floor. A look of joyful amazement over blood covered remains of his face, he tries to get up, bu can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, silhouetted, steps into the doorway. He holds a sh raised, ready to deliver a second, fatal blow... but when sees Early incapacitated on the floor, he lowers the shov to his side. His handcuffed hands reach down and picks up Early's gun. He trains it on Early, then walks around him enter the house. Brian's eyes slowly adjust to the interi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From on his back, Early looks out the open "door." He see two large shards of glass standing vertical in the sand,  reflecting the sun's rays back toward the house. He reali that the glass, placed there by Brian, is what created th effect of the "door." He starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) That was damn tricky of you Bri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian searches for Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie... Carrie... it's over.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIAN
dialogues.text: He moves into the back bedroom and finds Carrie. She is  crouched on the floor, handcuffed to the bedframe. He mov to help her. As he gets closer, he sees her badly bruised face and realizes what's taken place throughout the night Brian stops. The sympathetic expression on his face chang With hatred in his eyes, he pivots around, strides out of the bedroom and moves toward the front of the house to Ea in the front room Gun in hand, Brian rushes back into the room. He wields the pistol toward the ground where Early  lay... but Early's not there. Brian's eyes dart around the room... then suddenly, from  behind him, Early grabs him! He wrenches Brian's head back and whips his belt buckle k toward his throat! Brian manages to lift his hands to his neck an instant be the knife tears through his flesh. The knife slices a vic wound across the back of Brian's right hand. He drops the gun to the floor. Brian elbows Early in the ribs and pull away from him. He reaches to the ground for the gun, but  Early kicks him in the stomach and sends him crumbling to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead Bri, ask me something. (beat) You wanna know how I'm feeling'?  Well I'd say I'm feelin' pretty damn  good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On all fours, Brian reaches out for the gun, but Early ki it across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout you? You feelin' good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another kick to Brian's chest. The wind rushes out of him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...'Cause you sure don't look so  good. (beat) Or maybe you're feelin'... powerful.  That it, you feeling powerful?  Superior? I know I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early unloads a ferocious kick to the side of Brian's fac His head snaps back, his handcuffed arms buckle and he fa flat to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Am I angry with my daddy? Now  why would I be angry with my daddy...  you're the one hit me with the shovel.  And you're the one's gonna wish you  hadn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one last effort, Brian manages to pull himself back to his knees. He focuses on the gun ahead of him and trie to crawl toward it. But Early's foot shoves Brian. He fli over onto his back, landing in front of the bedroom doorw Early moves toward him, knife in hand. As Early moves toward Brian, unexpectedly from inside the doorway, the torso of the female child mannequin whips pa Her hardened molten face slams into Early's bloodied face Early stumbles backward. Brian crawls for the gun and grabs it. From his knees he  turns, steadies the weapon, takes a quick breath... and f Hitting Early square in the chest! Early falls to the ground on his back. Brian lifts himsel to his feet. He sees that Carrie has dragged the bedframe to the doorw and in her free hand she holds the child mannequin by the leg. Gun in hand, Brian steps over to Early. Early's body is s Blood oozes from the hole in his chest. On a silver chain around his neck is the key to Brian and Carrie's handcuff Brian reaches down and grabs the keys... when suddenly Ea arm springs up from his side. His hand grabs Brian's shir collar. Brian is startled by the move, then realizes that Early's hold is weak. His fingers tremble. Finally his ar drops back down to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bri... I think I need a doctor.  What d'ya say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men stare at one another for a moment... then Bri with one hand still on the handcuff keys, shoves the .45  automatic firmly under Early's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sorry 'bout this Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o.s. BANG!! rings out as... CLOSE UP on the chain and keys snapping free from Early's neck. CLOSE UP on Brian's handcuffs hitting the dusty wooden fl CLOSE UP on Carrie's handcuff swinging empty against the  rusty bedpost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A montage of the photographs taken throughout the journey Last image: A book "On The Road To Madness" By Brian Kess
